dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lush Pangani Mountains of Africa, mysterious and seemingly untouched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm golden light bathes the jungle. Shafts of sunlight filter through the forest floor. The sounds of WILD BIRDS break the hushed quiet of the setting. As we MOVE IN we FIND a large female mountain gorilla lounging, eating leaves in the dense undergrowth, her precocious baby gorilla plays nearby.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CAMERA LENS
dialogues.text: A view of the mother gorilla, a few PICTURES SNAPPED.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The photographer is RUTH YOUNG, naturalist, researcher, sitting in the undergrowth with her camera, notebooks, and sketch pad. Her precocious young daughter, JILL, plays nearby. Jill smiles, watching the baby gorilla clown. As the baby sees her, he suddenly scampers to a nearby tree and hides his face behind it. Jill does the same. She peeks out to catch a glimpse, just as the baby peeks out to catch her eye. They both scamper to different trees. Each time they move to a different tree, they go through this peek-a-boo interaction, both moving further away from their mothers. The mother GORILLA notices, lets out a CRY. Ruth looks around for Jill and signals by a distinctive whistle for her to come back this instant. Both children take a last look at each other and then scurry to their waiting mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill.   What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joe started it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good for them to interact with us. (gathering her things)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, that wasn't Joe. It was Marley.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill helps her mother heft the equipment as they start to head back to camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it wasn't.    It was Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is just a baby, Jill.      He was too big to be Joe. As they walk, they can see the sunset over the mountain trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.   Check the pictures. Ruth looks down at her daughter, surprised by the confidence in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Southern Cross above the horizon. The Milky Way a dusty streak of white. A shooting star streaks in an arc down to the --

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN RANGE
dialogues.text: The dark peaks silhouetted against the stellar glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charging THROUGH dense, primeval forest. We hear an eerie metallic JANGLE of what sounds like wind chimes riding right with us. Something is moving quickly up this mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bursting THROUGH FRAME -- a pack of mongrel hunting dogs driven hard by a half dozen African men with rifles. Poachers wielding pangas (machetes). A glint of silver as a panga sweeps ACROSS FRAME, hacking at the wall of thistles and nettles.

dialogues.speaker: ON DOGS
dialogues.text: Eyes yellow. Teeth flared. The RINGING sound made by TIN SQUARES cut from cans, tied by rawhide around their necks. CLANG-CLANG-CLANG. One poacher whips his panga again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PUNCH IN to reveal -- impaled in the earth, a three-foot stick figure with a macabre animal skull for a head. The poacher shouts in local dialect until -- A foul-looking man, GARTH, pushes INTO FRAME. Carrying a heavy Weatherby Mark V rifle across his back. Garth yanks the primitive doll from the ground. Looks back as -- A figure approaches in the darkness. A glowing cigar clenched in his stained teeth, STRASSER checks the doll over -- primitive, grotesque; then snaps it in two. Tossing it away contemptuously, he shouts orders in the local dialect. The men continue up the path. Dogs sweeping behind like a wildfire. CLANG-CLANG-CLANG. PAN UP OVER TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RING of the DOG COLLARS floats on a night breeze across a deep valley to the other side of the mountain, down to a...

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: A small circle of huts forming a campsite around a night fire. We go inside... one of them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth Young's hut. On one side is a makeshift field laboratory, highlighted by a wall collage of photos -- family shots mixed right in with gorilla shots.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: sits on the edge of a cot, tucking Jill into bed.   She leans down, kisses Jill gently on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, what made you think the gorilla we saw today was Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right, wasn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My notes say that Joe is only six months old. Either I got confused, or he's a very unusual gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing-song)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did. And Mommy's going to write it down in her book. She holds up a dog-eared composition book, Ruth's detaile log of her observations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. '... and my trusted colleague, Dr. Jill Young, showed me the error of my ways.' Jill smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go to sleep. Ruth begins singing a lullaby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sleep till the night ends, the night wind will sing for you. Your song and my song. It goes on forever.' As she sings, a man appears in the doorway. This is KWELI, the camp manager. He seems nervous and impatient, but doesn't want to disturb Ruth. Jill sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Kweli. Ruth turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli?   What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come. Quickly. As soon as she hears the words, Ruth is up.      As she l the hut, she grabs her walking stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, can I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, Jill. Ruth exits, Kweli behind her. Jill follows, despite her mother's orders... but Kweli feels her behind him. He turns around and crouches down, looking Jill seriously in the face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fatherly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Bahatu trackers have gathered in the center of the camp. They stand, silently, listening... The distant CHIMING of the poaching dogs is unmistakable ECHOING in the night. Ruth walks into the circle, also listening.      She turn Kweli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poachers. Kweli nods.    All the men look at Ruth for a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Swahili, subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Ruth leads them onto the forest path that goes up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR HUT
dialogues.text: Jill has not stayed in bed.       She has come out of the to watch the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother, silhouetted by moonlight, in her mind larger- than-life, pushes up the trail. Then she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser leads a breakneck pace through the woods. Garth looks around as the AFRICANS begin to murmur something ov and over. These men seem scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... n'gai zamu!... n'gai zamu!... Garth steps closer to keep up with Strasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mystical nonsense. There's only one thing they should be afraid of on this mountain. (threatening, to the men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's staring them right in the face! The men stare back at Strasser with equal hostility. Suddenly, Garth kneels and picks something from the ground. Rubs it between his fingers. Deposits it in Strasser's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorilla.   We're close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is pacing by the hut, trying to stay put like her mother said. Finally she can stand it no more. She grabs a long, stainless steel flashlight from a peg hanging on the outside of the hut and runs off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The African men fan out. It gets quiet fast. Strasser and Garth swing rifles down from their shoulders as they stalk. Proficient hunting machines.

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER
dialogues.text: His predator's eyes scanning the moonlit green tapestry. One more step -- then a dry POK-POK-POK sound erupts from the bushes. The DOGS BARK madly -- CLAPPERS RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trees shake furiously. Strasser spins to see several gorillas, darting from the trees, a blur of black shapes trying to escape up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: ONE FEMALE
dialogues.text: The same one Ruth watched earlier. Joe clings tightly to her back, his eyes wide with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nightmarish collage of images accompanied by the CLANGING of the dogs' COLLARS, the charge of the African poachers, the SCREAMS of the MOTHER and the other GORILLAS. Then he sees Strasser run forward, raise his rifle with icy precision.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SCOPE
dialogues.text: Strasser has Joe's mother dead on. Her head in the cross-hairs as she tries to get away. The MOTHER'S raspy animal SCREAM is unmistakably maternal, heart-breaking. It ECHOES across the mountain as she tries to reach a deep stretch of woods. On her back, Joe turns once more to look back and sees --

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER'S TRIGGER FINGER
dialogues.text: squeezing gently, the EXPLOSION of the SHOT RATTLES the forest. The MOTHER'S SCREAM is CUT OFF sharply.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOE
dialogues.text: We see Joe thrown THROUGH FRAME, tumbling into the high grass. Then, silence.

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER AND GARTH
dialogues.text: crash through the dense foliage to retrieve the body. The DOGS SNAPPING behind. CLANG-CLANG-CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Get the baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Don't shoot it! They want the babies alive!! Bring the sack!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS wildly, darts back and forth, desperately looking for his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the tall grass in the b.g., he can see the Africans disappear up the hill hunting down the others.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: And then we see Joe's anguish turn to fury. He GROWLS -- and as the two big hunters come nearer -- Joe springs out at them. Joe is moving so fast, Strasser barely has time to react before the furry black shape is on top of him -- WIDEN as Joe attacks Strasser, knocking him back. Strasser shouts and drops his rifle. Tries to pull Joe off as they tumble down through the trees. Strasser punches and pulls at this ball of sinew and muscle. He reaches for his Match Master side arm with his right hand. PUNCH IN CLOSE as Joe bites down viciously through the hand. Strasser howls...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: He has retrieved his rifle and is charging hard for his downed companion. He looks for a clear shot at Joe. PAN RIGHT and RACK FOCUS as Ruth Young explodes from the trees and flashes past Strasser, snatching Joe away. Joe is not quite sure what has happened, but he hangs on to Ruth for dear life. Strasser staggers forward, holding his mangled hand. Enraged. He rips Garth's gun away from him and with his bloodied hand, finds a way to pull the trigger. SHOTS RIP through BARK but Ruth disappears into the trees like a spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running but nearing exhaustion. Hearing a fusillade of GUNSHOTS -- Jill runs faster, panic contorting her face. She runs desperately, swiping at branches, stinging vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is running TOWARDS her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill shines her flashlight into the forest. Further up, someone waves a light back and forth. Like a signal. Jill's face lights up. She continues running. Suddenly, Jill is bowled over by Joe who leaps into her arms. They roll on the ground, Jill with the wind knocked out of her They look into each other's face and both know that the worst is happening. They are both silent with fear. Strasser appears through the darkness. His right hand wrapped in a bloody swath. Denying the pain. Garth follows, gun up. Jill and Joe lie hiding in the undergrowth. Jill's eyes tell Joe not to make a sound. They barely breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Strasser's and Garth's boots. Jill can hear the sound of their voices, but their words are indistinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) She's got to be here somewhere. She's got that damn devil with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) I think you might've hit the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) These people want to live like heroes, let them die like heroes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They are nearly on top of Jill and Joe, and their words are now crystal clear. Strasser looks at his bloody, wrapped hand and stares vindictively into the dark forest around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little demon took off my damn trigger finger. (in Roumanian) Monstrule!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your little 'monster' couldn't have gone far. Want to keep looking or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) No.    Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Joe lie still as stone as Strasser and Garth continue past. Once they're gone, Joe and Jill begin to breathe again. Then, Jill sees a light pop on in the darkness. She flashes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth suddenly emerges from the darkness.      She collaps next to Jill in the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mom, there were men, they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH'S HAND
dialogues.text: We see blood trickle down her fingers.       Ruth covers quickly so Jill can't see.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: JOE, clinging to Jill, begins to WHIMPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look who it is.    Hello, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor baby.   He lost his mommy tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth turns her attention from Joe to her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs someone to protect him. Will you do that for me, Jill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is taken aback by her mother's behavior. She knows something is wrong, but she doesn't know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll protect him, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth takes Jill into her arms. She rocks her back and forth, humming the lullaby we heard before.

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON --
dialogues.text: -- the three of them, huddled together in the dense jungl the lilting sound of Ruth's lullaby drifting through the night air. CAMERA FLOATS UP THROUGH the trees until it REVEALS and HOLDS ON the star-lit Pangani sky. RUTH'S VOICE EXPANDS INTO a CHORUS of POWERFUL AFRICAN VOICES SINGING the SAME LULLABY, now transformed into an inspirational hymn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: RUTH'S VOICE BECOMES a CHORUS of powerful AFRICAN VOICES SINGING the SAME LULLABY in the local dialect. But now it's become a powerful hymn -- sacred and inspirational. From the sky, flower petals of every color begin to fall. As they fall, they land on... A wooden plank that simply reads:     "RUTH YOUNG."

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS TO an adjacent marker that reads: "DR. EDWARD YOUNG" -- Jill's parents now reunited on that great mountain. WIDEN TO camp cemetery. Kweli lays Ruth's walking stick across her grave. Steps back -- not even trying to wipe away his tears. Jill stands bravely, singing through her broken heart. Kweli takes her hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: FROM WOODS
dialogues.text: Someone is watching all of this.    Staring directly at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kweli looks down at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, little one.   I will take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods, trying to stifle her tears. But she is now staring into the woods, sensing that she is being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will love living in the village. There are other children, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill pulls her hand away from Kweli's and starts walking toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she ignores him, breaking into a run, drawn inexorably toward the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: ON KWELI
dialogues.text: Starting after her at first, but then stopping.    He let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill pushes her way through the brush, finding Joe, waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: ON JILL
dialogues.text: Joe in her arms now, running through the woods as fast as she can, and we PULL BACK and...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Rolling foothills. Farms. Giving way to steeper slopes. The mountains rising just beyond.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: A quickly-moving dust cloud turns out to be --

dialogues.speaker: HUMVEE
dialogues.text: racing at breakneck speed over the dirt highway. Driven by GREGG O'HARA -- anyone would consider him young, strong and handsome -- except that right now, it's all hidden under the grime from a long flight and a week's growth of beard. Hair long, unkempt; clothes wrinkled. Gregg passes four local men burning a clearing in the woods for yet more farmland. Pushing its way up the mountain side. The humvee is packed with EQUIPMENT that RATTLES as Gregg hits every bump in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny African village, just a main square with a bar, a school, an infirmary and a gas station. Standing smack in the middle of the road is an East India with a goatee, wrap-around Black Flys, and a Nike workout suit. Gregg's HUMVEE SKIDS to a sharp stop in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Pindi. Pindi flashes him a broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one and only, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi is leading Gregg down a row of vehicles: two Land Rovers, one with a strange-looking seat attached to the front hood, and an old, flatbed lorry. A surly-looking group of men lounge around on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six men, three cars... everything you ask for, Mr. Ohara. (lowering his voice) All paid for in advance, out of Pindi's pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg holds an envelope filled with cash in Pindi's face. He nods towards the nasty-looking men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet-looking bunch of guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi snatches the envelope -- but Gregg holds onto his end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked for experienced trackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are the best -- I assure you. Very best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg allows Pindi to pull the envelope away. He immediately rifles through the cash, checking to make sur it's all there. Gregg eyes Pindi's men suspiciously, then walks around to the back of his humvee and flips open the storage boot, revealing an array of animal-tracking gadgetry. Pindi looks over his shoulder as Gregg loads a menacing-looking rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice piece you got there. What are we hunting, elephants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not hunting anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi sees that Gregg is loading the rifle with tran- quilizer darts. This confuses him, but he pretends to approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Tranquilizer darts. I agree -- much nicer to animals than bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating tranquilizer gun) Your men know how to use this, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, boss.     Only professionals here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg carefully puts the rifle back, then grabs a pair of Minolta 10x20 binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, boss -- where are we going today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Gregg, panning across his field of vision with the binoculars. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The highest peak in the range, playing hide and seek with the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Pindi's men see where Gregg is pointing. They murmur, trading grim glances at each other. Pindi jumps with nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There? Uh, boss, that is not such a good mountain. The men don't like it very much at all. You see there is a legend they believe in, that a creature lives there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg's back to checking his equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'N'Gai Zamu.' The sacred guardian of Mount Pangani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi looks at Gregg, surprised he knows this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it? How funny! (with dread) That's not, by any chance, what you are looking for, is it, boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg looks from Pindi's nervous face to the serious faces of the trackers. They are all watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a legend?   No.   Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg takes the car keys from Pindi's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Pindi -- not particularly thrilled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan trundles up a winding dirt road, into the mist-covered mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicles are circled in a clearing. Three small audio dishes have been positioned to triangulate the location of the slightest sound. An infrared video cam is mounted on a tripod. A geometric, field-assembled cage made of an impact-resistant, high-tensile steel alloy sits off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg has earphones on, plugged into a backpack with a Sony digital recorder, listening. The sound is ambient and mysterious. Pindi stands behind Gregg, watching him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you listening to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi listens to the jungle. It is full of sounds. Something small makes a RUSTLING SOUND a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that right there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand completely: jungle sounds! Very important. I know a guy, he can get you a C.D. of jungle sounds, cheap. Even cheaper if you buy ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg puts his hand up to signal for quiet. He hears something. He listens intently for a moment, then the WHOOSH of a SPRING TRAP BLASTS his ears, followed by shouts and the sound of an ANIMAL SCREECHING. Gregg throws off the headphones, grabs a strange-looking pole called a DNA plug gun, and crashes with Pindi through the woods. Gregg runs INTO FRAME to see several of Pindi's men closing the cage on a lithe, young leopard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) How do you like that, boss? I told you these men were the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg kneels to inspect the leopard. He finds it beautiful -- his face softens at the sight of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing, to leopard) You're a beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, he extends the DNA plug gun and pricks the cat startling it and causing all the men to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands) Okay, set him free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Pindi stand over the leopard.       Pindi offer ersatz smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testing the water) Why ask for a cage if you are not keeping the animal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg releases the vial of blood from the DNA gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm only keeping this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I know a guy, in Botswana, he'd pay you ten thousand American dollars for that leopard. I'd be willing to split with you -- fifty/fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg ignores Pindi. He's busy transferring the vial to a container. Pindi presses on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you're right. Sixty to you, forty to me. That's a very fair deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response from Gregg -- he's logging notes into a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness -- you're an excellent negotiator. Okay, boss! Seventy/thirty it is. (to his men) Take him to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men bend over and hoist the cage up -- but now Gregg blocks their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the cat down... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg is one scary-looking bastard.     The men drop the cage. Pindi back-pedals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("angry," to his men) You heard him... put it down! (to Gregg) They never understand me. I don't know what to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi stops abruptly as his yammering is interrupted by the LEOPARD, GROWLING. SOUND CUE:    A LOW RUMBLE. Floating on the wind like DISTANT THUNDER. It seems to come as an answer to the young leopard's cry. Birds fly out of the trees above the cage. The men are spooked.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: quickly puts on his headphones and listens to the amplified sound again. HIGH-PITCHED SCREAMS -- then the rhythmic rondo of sharp POK-POK-POK-POK CHESTBEATS. Pindi is on the verge of panic.       He forces his trade smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me.     Time to flee, right?

dialogues.speaker: TREES
dialogues.text: The top branches suddenly shake violently -- sending a sharp WOODEN RATTLE across the meadow. Is that a shadow from a passing cloud that seems to ripple through the foliage? Gregg steps closer. The trees bend like the wake of a boat -- they bend in a straight line. Something powerful and unseen is moving through the trees. Pindi and his men retreat back in the meadow. Gregg scans the forest. BRANCHES spring with a LOUD WHOOSH! Gregg can't help it -- his fear takes over and he backsteps into the meadow. WIDEN SHOT UP TO the trees. Catapulting DOWN THROUGH FRAME -- landing right in front of them is a gorilla -- nearly 15 feet high. The GROUND TREMBLES from the force. A nearby Land Rover bounces two feet into the air from th impact. His canines are fully exposed. Thick, black hair on his crest stand erect. Deep brown eyes aglow as he gives another DEAFENING CALL. This is JOE. Backlit by the sun he seems to encompass the forest. PUSH IN CLOSE ON Gregg's reaction.       In complete awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't anybody move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened out of his wits) How about... I move... just over here...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pindi scurries for cover behind the frozen, awe- stricken trackers.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: moves to the cage and peers inside. The LEOPARD paces and HISSES. Joe straightens up bi-pedally and pounds his massive chest with his fist. The hollow POK-POK-POK ECHOE off the mountain. Joe raises his hand again and smashes the top off the cage, as if it were made of matchsticks. The leopard leaps out of the cage and dashes safely into the forest. JOE bares his teeth and ROARS at Gregg, as if to say "stay off my mountain." His mission accomplished, Joe quickly turns and starts back for tree cover. Silence. Everyone is open-mouthed, unable to believe what they have just seen... Then Greg snaps out of it. Bursting into action, he runs to the humvee, motions to Pindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!!   We're going after him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this 'we'? There is no way my men will ever agree to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg yells to the paralyzed trackers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Swahili) Three times your price. (in English) Triple your fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it's all about. The men get a move on, running for the vehicles as fast as they can. ENGINES REV, DOORS SLAM, as the trackers ready for the chase. All four cars pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is silent for a moment, then Joe EXPLODES INTO FRAME. Joe hears the DRONE of ENGINES -- turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan, looking like the cavalry in a Western, comes charging over the hill. Gregg's humvee comes crashing over a ridge in pursuit of Joe. Gregg yells out to the cars around him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herd him towards me!   I gotta get close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg grabs his DNA stick and grins at Pindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi realizes with a sickening feeling that Gregg is having a major rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead car, a Land Rover, comes right up behind Joe.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Joe -- sensing the car next to him, turns and ROARS...

dialogues.speaker: LAND ROVER
dialogues.text: The guy with the tranquilizer RIFLE panics and FIRES!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON JOE
dialogues.text: The dart hits his arm.     Uh oh.   That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tracker has just enough time to get a good look at Joe's furious expression before... WHAM! Joe throws his shoulder into the side of the Land Rover, sending it tumbling end over end into a ravine.

dialogues.speaker: ON GREGG
dialogues.text: Disgusted with the guys' stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Experienced trackers, my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi shrugs. The two of them watch as Joe continues running, then changes directions and starts heading straight for them. The humvee has to swerve out of the way to avoid colliding with Joe. FOLLOW JOE as he books across the meadow in the opposite direction, now. The modified Land Rover with the hot seat attached to the hood swerves around and chases Joe. They catch up, and the tracker climbs into the hot seat, readying a metal clamp attached to a chain...

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: tries to yell across at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, the guy's slapped the clamp onto Joe's arm. Joe ROARS, tries to shake off the chain, then speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIN
dialogues.text: unspools rapidly, whipping out from the front of the modified Land Rover. Quickly, it grows taut and now the Rover is being pulled by Joe. The driver slams on the brakes with both feet, but all that does is tilt the fron end upwards, digging up clods of dirt as they're dragged along.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: feels the increased pull, and is starting to get annoyed. He heads right for...

dialogues.speaker: STAND OF TREES
dialogues.text: The guy in the hot seat is battered by branches and leave as they're dragged through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON HUMVEE
dialogues.text: Now circling around the stand of trees, trying to catch u with Joe when he emerges from the opposite side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the wheel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gregg hands the wheel over to Pindi as he reaches for his DNA gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe has just emerged from the tree stand, dragging the thoroughly-battered, modified Land Rover and its dazed occupants. Joe sees the humvee heading towards him.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: His brow furrows. Is he coming up with a plan?     He mak a ninety degree turn...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON GREGG
dialogues.text: Who is intently screwing a telescoping extension on the DNA plug gun. Pindi gapes at what Gregg is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you are planning on throwing that at him, because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi!   Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi looks forward again just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIN
dialogues.text: Pulled taut between Joe and the modified Land Rover, has become a moving clothesline, and the humvee is heading right into its path. Pindi tries to swerve, but they can't avoid it. He ducks and... Gregg leaps out of the car, hurdling the chain, just as.. It shears the top right off the vehicle! Gregg tumbles to the ground, as the humvee rolls to a sto nearby. Meanwhile, the --

dialogues.speaker: LAND ROVER
dialogues.text: is SPINNING OUT, still connected to Joe. Joe is almost curious about the chain. He begins to pull back as the modified Land Rover circles him. The modified Land Rover bucks -- and for a second there is a standstill. Then Joe yanks...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And the chain, the winch, the tracker in the hot seat... in fact, the entire axle of the modified Land Rover, are pulled from their moorings. The tracker racks up against a tree, followed closely by his chair and winch... The axle tumbles to a stop... The LAND ROVER COLLAPSES like a stack of cards.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: stands at the edge of the field, observing his victory. Then he beats his chest and ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: IN MEADOW
dialogues.text: Pindi and his men run to the one remaining car, the flatbed lorry. They all pile in and speed away across the field. Pindi sees something up ahead, yells at the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LORRY SCREECHES to a halt, right next to Gregg, who i stumbling towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, bro!     Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi watches as Gregg stumbles around to the back of the truck. But instead of getting in, he grabs a silver case and pulls it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, boss, but please, I would like to avoid being killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg flips opens the case, revealing a video camera. hoists it up, and barely able to walk, takes one last look at Pindi and the bruised and busted-up trackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those men down the mountain. They need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg takes off after Joe.       Pindi can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy Americans!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He slaps the driver on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They PEEL OUT of there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring down the path of crushed growth that Joe has left in his wake. He takes a deep breath, then exhales. Then he heads off into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Gregg DOWN a wide trail of broken limbs leading into the densest part of the mountain. Thorns and stingers scratch Gregg as he fights his way through.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: The green paradise of the mountain rushes right AT us. Bright blossoms and strange insects. The sun diffuses in daggers of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg climbs over a fallen tree. Ducks under some low branches. Stops to catch his breath. He listens intently. Takes another step forward. Hears a TWIG SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: PAN RIGHT. Joe springs out from hiding -- as gorillas love to do to enemies. He charges Gregg and cuffs him onto his back. Joe is in full attack mode -- eyes wide, teeth exposed. He snatches Gregg by the foot.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: screams as he's jerked helplessly into the air. Joe shakes Gregg viciously -- then whips him back and forth, knocking him against a sapling. Gregg fights to free himself but he's no match for Joe's strength. He knows Joe is going to hurt him badly -- maybe kill him. Joe cocks his arm -- to crush Gregg against a wide tree trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!   Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks surprised, caught with his hand in the cookie jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful young woman is standing ten feet from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Jill -- she looks at Gregg like he's the lowest form of life on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... drop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Joe does, dropping Gregg hard to the ground.   On his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER BLACK, we hear the MURMUR of VOICES, speaking in Swahili. PICTURE FADES UP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING UP AT KWELI, 12 years older than we last saw him. Kweli looks right INTO CAMERA, then says something over his shoulder in Swahili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruised and bandaged, Gregg blinks, trying to bring his eyes into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infirmary. You've been unconscious for an entire night. You're lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg winces as he slowly raises himself to his elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, I don't feel lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes in his surroundings; a simple infirmary. THROUGH the open door, he can see the village he started his trip in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crashed your vehicle. It is waiting for you outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an injury behind. The kicker was getting dropped on my head by N'gai Zamu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think that's funny? You should try it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N'Gai Zamu is just a legend, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's a giant gorilla with a mean backhand. There was also a woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg tries to get up.     It's an ordeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the jungle. She saved my life. A beautiful woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli gives him a patronizing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were dreaming, Mr. Ohara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    I never remember my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg sits up in bed and swings his feet to the floor. Kweli turns and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be wise for you to see a doctor in Kimjayo. I took the liberty of calling one for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he is expecting you. If you can drive, you should leave today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli walks out of the room. Gregg squints after him, sensing that something is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg walks gingerly out of the infirmary, looking like crap. He squints in the bright midday sun, then spots... The humvee, a mere shadow of its former self, parked right near the infirmary, covered with a tarp. Gregg pulls the tarp back to find all his expensive equipment, a good deal of it broken, pitchforked into the back. He scowls. He starts rummaging through the stuff, looking for some- thing in particular. Then he finds it -- his video camera, covered with mud, but seemingly in good condi- tion. He pushes the record button. Light goes on. Still works. He pops open the tape slot, and his face falls.     The video cassette has been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a   group of village schoolchildren dash by Gregg. They    are giggling, as if they had dared each other to run   up to the stranger. They sing out the one English word   they know as they pass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!    Hello!     Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg shakes his head, smiling, and follows them with his eyes as they fly by like a flock of birds. He watches as they dart into the open air market, playfully knocking aside a familiar individual: Kweli.    We watch from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kweli steps into a fruit stall, letting the kids fly by him. Then Gregg's eyes widen as a tall and lovely young woman steps INTO VIEW next to Kweli.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He watches as they shop together, realizing that this is, in fact, the beautiful young woman who saved him.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli and Jill have a familial ease with each other as they pick out their groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our visitor must be feeling better. He should be leaving the infirmary today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks up toward the infirmary and sees Gregg leaning against his truck, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he just has.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill nods across the street. Kweli looks and sees that Gregg is leaning against his Jeep, arms folded across his chest, staring at them with a mixture of amusement and irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's walking so soon. Joe should have dropped him harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a poacher, Jill. He's working for an animal conservancy in California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) He can't be trusted.   He's an outsider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grateful outsider. He told me he was saved yesterday by a woman. (teasing Jill) A beautiful woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks at Kweli sharply, then back across the street at Gregg, whose eyes continue to assess her. She looks straight back at him, locking into his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could I tell him? He knows what he saw. He's not a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg are still holding each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be the judge of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, Gregg is breaking into a big, slow smile. It unnerves Jill. Kweli, always Jill's protector, catches the action between the two of them and bristles a bit -- but Jill has already turned her back and taken off through the back of the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Ruth Young was suited to these woods, her daughter was born to them.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She hikes through the forest effortlessly, as though it were her own back yard. As she walks near the banks of a river, however, she stops. She listens carefully, sensing something out there, in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND TREE, (NEARBY)
dialogues.text: Gregg, his video camera in one hand, stands stock still behind a tree, trying to avoid being discovered. He is absolutely drenched in sweat, the long hike clearly much harder than Jill has made it look.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JILL
dialogues.text: Still listening. All she can hear are the familiar SOUNDS of the JUNGLE. A moment passes, then she shakes it off and keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill comes out into a clearing, bordered by a large pool at the base of a magnificent waterfall. She pulls a flashlight out of her back pack and, in the same motion her mother used to summon her, begins waving it back and forth into the surrounding forest.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: watches this bizarre ritual, wondering what Jill could possibly be doing.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP IN WOODS
dialogues.text: The beam of light cuts through the deep green darkness of the trees.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jill continues waving the flashlight, waiting for a response. Then, we hear the sound of SOMETHING LARGE APPROACHING.

dialogues.speaker: ON GREGG
dialogues.text: The thunderous sound making him nervous...

dialogues.speaker: ON JILL
dialogues.text: Not so Jill. She waits calmly, at first, as the FOOT- STEPS APPROACH. Then, as the branches begin to bend and break, and we get our first glimpse of fur, she smiles. Mighty Joe Young emerges from the brush, not growling, not threatening, but rather looking like a puppy coming to greet his master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cooing to Joe) Hey, handsome. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: ON GREGG
dialogues.text: Absolutely thunderstruck, watching in awe as the giant GORILLA bows his head so Jill can scratch behind his ear. He makes LOW, GUTTURAL SOUNDS that are the gorilla equivalent of a purr. Jill inspects Joe, checking him to see if he's okay. voice is full of gentle concern and worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking yesterday, letting those men see you? Don't do that again, okay? Please. (praying to herself) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the fear in Jill's face, knowing that Joe can't understand what she's saying. She shakes it off and brightens. She gives Joe a playful tussle, then covers her eyes with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.   Two.   Three. Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes only a moment for Joe to respond. His eyes open wide, he looks in every direction then, suddenly, crashes into the woods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... seven, eight, nine, ten. (yelling) Ready or not, here I come!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jill runs into the woods after Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill walks through the forest, searching for Joe. It should be clear by now that they are playing hide and seek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (theatrically) Oh, my God! I can't find Joe. Where's Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stomps around, pretending not to see him. Of course, she knows exactly where he is. He's so big, the tree he's standing behind barely hides one leg.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: He can't help peeking.    He loves this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill pokes her head around every tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out, come out... wherever you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, pretending that she just spotted him, she charges right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE ROARS, delighted by their game. Jill tussles with him, then gets a mischievous look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye, Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, she dashes into the woods -- where she's actually small enough to hide well. Joe passes by her, moving through the foliage. In a moment we see how much he fears actually losing her -- he begins to WHIMPER -- and spins around. He stands up to his full height, beats his chest and shakes his head in frustration. He can't bear the idea that she is gone. A beat, then Joe starts tearing bushes out by their roots hunting for Jill. He sees one BUSH RUSTLING, goes over and rips it out of the ground, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: Standing there, completely exposed, filming all this with his dented video camera. He looks up at Joe towering over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ROARS
dialogues.text: Gregg stumbles backwards, trapping himself against a tree as Joe advances. Remembering what one should do when faced with an enraged gorilla. Gregg averts his eyes and rolls into a ball, assuming the submissive position. He's like a pill bug, playing dead, protecting the back of his neck with his arms. Joe raises his mighty fist -- it looks like he might smash Gregg anyway... but then he hears Jill's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) Joe!   It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stops and turns his head to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get out of here, Joe.     Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks at her, not sure why her tone's gotten so stern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Joe.   Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks back at Gregg, still curled into a tight ball. He gives him a playful, parting swat for good measure before obeying Jill and running into the forest. The "little swat" is powerful enough to send Gregg rollin like a croquet ball into a thicket of bushes. Painfully, he uncurls, plucking nettles out of his legs as Jill approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling out a nettle) Nobody better try and tell me I imagined this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill reaches down to Gregg.        He thinks she's offeri a hand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking himself) No... no. I think I'm... oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg's voice trails off as Jill reaches for the video camera, not him. She examines the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm -- it looks okay.     I think it's still working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Oh -- good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I can fix that.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill smashes the camera into a tree, breaking it for good. She drops the pieces onto the ground and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Hey -- wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is making good time down the rough terrain of the river bank. Gregg catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a second -- what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. You're the problem. That's the second time I've stopped you from being ripped in two -- and next time I'm just going to watch. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appeasing) You saved me. I'm grateful. Now I just want to talk to you -- Miss Young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stops in her tracks and shoots Gregg a surprised look. He explains gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. I read all your mother's work. Books... notes... everything I could get a hold of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding emotion) So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill gives a short nod, accepting this tribute. She turns back around and resumes walking. Gregg follows, bursting with questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew about Joe? Did she have a theory on him? How old is he? I can't believe you kept him a secret all these years. How'd you manage that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By keeping people like you off the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got this all wrong.   I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not helping anybody here. You're just making matters worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mountain will be crawling with people, thanks to you. You go back to wherever you're from, put the word out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word is out. It's done. I'm not the only one who saw him, remember? Rare animals mean big money and Joe's as rare as they come. It's going to be tough to protect him here. Maybe impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill spins on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Here' is Joe's home. And 'here' is where he must live. He doesn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Place that sent me could take care of Joe. They got the facilities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what Joe needs.   A cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a cage, a preserve. A place where he'll be free from poachers, free from land development...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he won't be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think Joe will stay free here? I'm telling you there's gonna be a hunt starting on this mountain tomorrow. And I don't expect they'll give it up until one of them bags the prize. You should think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill hates the ring of truth in Gregg's words.     She tu and takes off down the mountain alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giraffe roam the grounds of a lush, private preserve, surrounding a large, opulent, main house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite an impressive facility you have here, Mr. Strasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRASSER sits in a leather chair, in an expensively- appointed room. His rough exterior has been polished by money, but his cold eyes have not changed. Sitting across from him is ANDERSON, the button-down director of the Cascade Park Zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, why is it that you keep such a low profile about this wonderful place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our only interest is the well- being of our animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (satisfied) Well, I think I've come to the right place for Morris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson puts some photos on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: of a full-grown Bengal tiger, looking miserable in a fairly small enclosure. We see insignias for the Cascade Park Zoo on the fences around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see how depressed he is. He's grown out of his habitat, and our zoo doesn't have the budget to do anything about it. That's why he needs a new home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser reaches out to pick up the photos, and as he does...

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER'S HAND
dialogues.text: A black leather glove-like apparatus with a thumb and forefinger in place that gives the appearance of a whole, if menacing, hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing. Yes, he will be much happier here on our preserve. Back to the wild. Free again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens behind Anderson.       Garth sticks his head the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone for you.     Urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you excuse me, Mr. Anderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser turns and follows Garth through the door, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a room that would give dear Mr. Anderson nightmares. A man in a white smock is packaging poached rhino horns into boxes. The boxes, labelled medical supplies, are being sent to addresses in China. On another wall, in front of a bank of telephones, is a dry-erase board covered with animal names, and their respective prices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what our friends in China will give us for a Bengal tiger, Garth. Strasser hands Garth the photo of the tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a big fellah. (excited, looking at photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll set a new record with you. Strasser picks up one of the phones.   He idly plays with a rhino horn as he talks to Pindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time already! You know how long I am waiting? A man can only carry so much change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Pindi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small street of stores -- all covered in brightly- painted advertisements. Outside one store is a lone pay phone -- manned by Pindi. Pindi speaks furtively, so as not to be overheard. INTERCUT conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I want, boss, what you want. How about a giant gorilla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big as three men, two thousand pounds, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been drinking, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God, boss. Saw him with my own two eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waste my time again.

dialogues.speaker: ON PINDI
dialogues.text: There is a CLICK on the LINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Boss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a DIAL TONE.      Pindi looks at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch him and charge you double, madar chode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pindi smashes the phone down on its cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the village, two trucks of rough-looking men are gassing up their vehicles. A third truck arrives from the other direction. It's a POACHER we recognize, one of Pindi's men, accompanied by a half dozen others, all armed with rifles

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: She steps out in front of the Poacher's truck. The driver SLAMS on the BRAKES, stopping within an inch of striking her. Alarmed, the Poacher stands in his seat and screams at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid girl! What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill calmly walks up to the Poacher's side of the vehicle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this in the forest this morning. Thought maybe you dropped it and might want it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Jill brazenly steps forward and throws a net over his head. It's a poacher's net. Enraged, the Poacher slowly pulls the net off his head. The other poachers find the scene hilarious. It infuriates Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poaching is illegal!   Get off this mountain!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Poacher and his driver exchange a significant look. Nodding to each other, they start to climb out of their truck, eyes glaring at Jill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill!   Jill Young!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to see Kweli walking quickly towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jill) Come here immediately! You are needed at the school this moment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli is trying to give her a way to save face. Jill knows it, but she doesn't want to back down before the poachers. Kweli snatches Jill by the elbow and drags her away. poachers hiss and cat call. Jill walks away slowly. wants to make sure they know she's not running. Kweli hisses furiously into her ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to talk. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jill's mother's hut. It is full of significant mementos -- her mother's old bulletin board, photographs, research, etc. It feels homey. Kweli, distraught with worries over Jill, rips a photo of her mother from the wall and shoves it in front of her fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother slept in this bed. She worked at this desk. She died in this jungle. Do you plan to do everything just like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother would have been proud of what I did today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Proud? Of that foolishness out there? Of you risking your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She risked hers -- why shouldn't I risk mine? I'm just doing what I promised, and I promised to protect Joe. And I'm going to do everything I can to stop the poachers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop them. (more gently) Even she couldn't stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill holds the photo of her mother tightly in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, the other gorillas have moved south, to safer lands... but Joe has stayed behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want him.   They won't let him come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... or maybe you won't let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) He needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only half the truth, and they both know the other half -- that Jill needs Joe, too. Kweli sighs. He puts his hand protectively on Jill's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The danger here is building for both of you. I feel it -- and so do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks away.    She knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the American is offering, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks into Kweli's eyes. He must be very worried, to be checking around like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what he has to say. That's all I ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli leaves Jill to mull it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poacher's truck, carrying six rowdy poachers, speeds down the main street, kicking up a cloud of dust. The dust cloud envelops Gregg, making him cough as he repacks some of the damaged equipment in his truck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hears more coughing behind him and turns to find Jill at his shoulder. She has a troubled air about her -- clearly she is wrestling with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg nods, continuing packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head up the mountain. See if I can throw some of the poachers off the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious) You think it will work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. Just trying to buy you a little time, that's all. With more of these bastards arriving every hour, I suggest you get Joe as deep into the jungle as you can -- as fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street at the bar, a chorus of CACKLES rises from a group of drunken poachers. The mere sound of them makes Jill dig her fingers into her arms with anxiety. She looks across at the poachers -- and then back to Gregg, packing up. If she doesn't say this right now, this second, she never will. She snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay we'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Joe. To that place of yours in California. (off Gregg's look) What?! You didn't think you could take him without me, did you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gregg stops packing to look squarely at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am completely unsure about this. But I'll do it. On one condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in charge of Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Done? Just like that?     That was way too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a very trusting soul are you, Miss Young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Tough, isn't it? Trying to measure me up -- decide if I'm a fraud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... or a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg smiles, half sour, half amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to know if you're a bona fide lunatic or just a mixed up monkey girl but -- but I guess we'll have to take our chances and figure it out as we go along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill snorts.    Gregg looks her straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jill. Trust it.      You'll be in charge of Joe. (extends hand) Let's shake on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't shake. That's not how we make pacts around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing impatient) Alright, how do you make pacts around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to endure a bite from a Makiki spider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have a high fever and hallucinations. You'll say things -- lots of things. We'll hear what's in your heart. Then, if your intentions prove true, the pact is made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg nods to himself, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spider bite and hallucinations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll trust me and let me have Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.    Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg cocks his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I think... that's the biggest load of crap I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill smiles. She's satisfied.         This is the answer was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Maybe you're not a fool after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg scoffs, realizing she was only testing him. Jill turns and starts walking away. Gregg calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your things together. Fast. We're getting out of here as soon as we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg watches her go, head held high like a queen. He chuckles to himself. It's hard not to appreciate this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Makiki spider.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Jill bursts INTO FRAME -- racing at full stride, long hair flowing -- so reminiscent of that little girl we saw before -- a wild mixture of fluid grace and strength. The trees seem to fly apart behind her revealing Joe -- running with her. As if speed alone could make their enemies disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill watches the clouds rush by the mountaintop. Joe stands next to her, looking out at the mountain valley where they've grown up together. Wind sweeps down from the peak. The trees bow and bend gracefully. To Jill, the mountain has never seemed more beautiful. She looks at Joe -- magnificent against the natural tableau of his world. She looks at him, worry on her face about what is about to happen to him. He looks at her trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP so we can see Joe and Jill against the Edenic mountain vista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlit against a blue sky. PAN DOWN as the wind RUSTLES the TREES and a flock of small birds appear and disappear like a storm cloud. CONTINUE DOWN PAST a waterfall, as we COME TO a grassy field, then a moat, then, finally, a railing at the edge of an observation area.

dialogues.speaker: NOW REVEAL
dialogues.text: That what we are looking at is not, in fact, the African landscape, but rather a fabricated habitat, encircled by a sprawling campus of stucco buildings. Workers in matching uniforms with the "CALIFORNIA ANIMAL CONSERVANCY" logo on them, run back and forth, a hive of activity in anticipation of the new arrival. PULL IN ON two of them, walking and talking: DR. HARRY RUBEN, the Conservancy's Director and Chief Zoologist, and DR. CECILY BANKS, an African-American veterinarian with long braids stuffed under a baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. All I said was, 'Bring back some blood samples.' So what does he bring back? A giant gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even pretend to be upset, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much it cost to convert the tiger habitat? Try half our operating budget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be on the cover of National Geographic, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I just said it was crazy.    I didn't say it wasn't worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue walking, and we...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy freeway, near Los Angeles. FIND a car with a California Animal Conservancy logo on the side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg drives. Jill, almost bouncing with anxiety and excitement, rides shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are more cars on this road than I've seen in my entire life, total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill whips around in her car seat and peers anxiously through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the cab of a large trailer following their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) Think he's okay back there?   I think he's okay back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three seconds pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's okay back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) Don't worry. He's doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.    I'm a little tense. (checking behind her again) Yeah.    I think he's okay back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    Thanks for the update.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill pulls herself away from the back window and faces front again. She stares out at the nondescript sprawl of greater L.A. It looks like non-place. There is no "there" there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is L.A. (perplexed) It all looks the same.   How do you know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beach is that way, mountains are that way, Mexico's that way, Canada's that way. Don't worry about the rest -- you'll never see it through the smog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg glances over at Jill. She is drumming her fingers in her lap with nerves, not listening to a word he's saying. Gregg smiles with empathetic amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better check and see if Joe's okay back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill obediently whips around in her seat to check for Joe -- then realizes Gregg was teasing. She settles back down, facing front again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushing) Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A livestock truck, same conservancy labels, travels right behind Gregg and Jill's vehicle. Heavy, open air slats obscure the truck's occupant, but we know who it is.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING OUT
dialogues.text: Traffic rushes by, a buffeting rush of air -- the strangeness of it all frightens Joe -- and makes him curious. PUSH IN CLOSE ON the air slats as Joe peers out again.

dialogues.speaker: MINIVAN
dialogues.text: comes INTO FRAME passing by the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mom drives her son home from little league. She listens to an OLDIES station. He looks out the window, bored. Then his eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN CLOSE ON the trailer and Joe's two big eyes staring out. They lock eyes momentarily. The boy isn't sure if he's seeing things. Then two enormous fingers extend out from between the slats and wave at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: For the boy it is a beat of pure astonishment. As if a daydream came real for the moment. The trailer pulls past leaving the boy wide-eyed, wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill's car pulls onto the grounds of the California Animal Conservancy. A sprawling campus of stucco buildings and lifelike habitats, the conservancy is a state-of-the-art preserve. The car passes the main gate, where a worker in a conservancy uniform waves Gregg through. As the live- stock truck pulls in behind them, the worker picks up his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main gate to Dr. Banks. They're pulling up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily clicks off her walkie-talkie, turns and yells to anyone in earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvis is in the building! I repeat, Elvis is in the building... On her order, workers in matching conservancy uniforms start moving into position around Joe's Habitat.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR OBSERVATION AREA
dialogues.text: A crane is lowering a platform into place that will straddle the moat. Harry scowls, seemingly unable to enjoy the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, Harry? From around the conservancy, we can hear the sounds of the other ANIMALS, SCREECHING, SNARLING, BELLOWING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg, or the gorilla? They both turn as...

dialogues.speaker: CONSERVANCY CAR
dialogues.text: pulls up right in front of them.         Gregg gets out f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused, O'Hara. You phone us to say you're bringing back a two thousand pound wild animal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry.     Cecily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionate) Welcome back, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but security tells me you've requested no firehoses, no restraints of any kind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me introduce you to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to control the animal? With a giant, rolled-up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry trails off as Jill gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... newspaper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry wasn't prepared for somebody this young and beautiful. Neither was Cecily. They raise their eyebrows at Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill Young, Dr. Harry Ruben -- he run the place -- and Dr. Cecily Banks, who makes sure he doesn't screw it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Chief veterinarian. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill steps forward, shy and polite.        She extends he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. It's a privilege to meet you both.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry is too flustered by Jill to say a word. He just manages a weird little smile and a sound that's not English. Just then, a BANG and a loud GROWL come out of the trailer. Harry and Cecily almost jump out of their skins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming, Joe! Hold on! (to Harry) I think he'd like to come out now -- if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering, scared) Mind?    No, of course I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg look at each other, excited. This is the moment they've been waiting for. They grin at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?   I think it's time you met Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start moving to the trailer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry whirls around and waves over a pair of nerdy, grad- school-geek conservancy workers, JACK and VERN. They run eagerly forward to take orders. They gawk at Jill, each one instantly deciding she is the woman of their dreams. Harry barks at them, bringing them back to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Vern?    Get the sedatives ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) We won't need any of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Young, we know what we're doing here, and the best way to...
