dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -- you and I made an agreement. The lady's in charge of Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Vern nervously raise the gate to the back of the trailer. The gate lays flat against a retractable plank that creates a bridge to the habitat. JOE GROWLS SOFTLY from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, big boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget who's gonna feed you. They raise the gate completely.    Jill comes up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here. Jack and Vern are only too happy to let Jill take over.

dialogues.speaker: FROM TRAILER DOOR
dialogues.text: He can hear Jill but sees only her silhouette at first... and the lush greenery behind her. He GROWLS... The entire staff, other than Gregg, takes one step back- ward. Harry whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure she knows what she's doing? Gregg's watching Jill with quiet admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: BACK BY TRAILER
dialogues.text: Jill keeps coaxing Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Joe.     Come on, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW
dialogues.text: passes over the staff of the conservancy. A look of absolute wonderment on every face as Joe emerges from the trailer. Cecily nudges Harry, whose jaw is slack. Gregg sees this reaction, and beams.

dialogues.speaker: BY TRAILER
dialogues.text: Joe takes a step forward. He looks out across the plat- form into the sanctuary -- taking in the familiar trees and flowers the staff has planted for him.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY AND CECILY
dialogues.text: Completely overwhelmed by the sight of this massive creature. Cecily manages a few words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is one, big gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JOE
dialogues.text: His head turning sideways at the sound of her voice. A tense moment, as Joe glares at the assembled crowd. He is magnificent. Awesome. Staggering. Harry knows a photo-op when he sees one.     He whispers loudly to Vern:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What do I pay you for?    Get some shots -- of me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vern picks up a camera and scrambles to get into position -- but he's so nervous that he trips, sprawling on the ground and startling Joe. Joe turns and scampers back into the trailer. Vern gets back on his feet, red-faced. Jill glares at Harry. Gregg just chuckles at the stupidity. Harry blames Vern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- he did it.

dialogues.speaker: BY TRAILER
dialogues.text: Jill walks to the edge of the trailer.     She coos into darkened interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, ya big baby. Come on back.   Do I have to come in there and get you myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads into the trailer after him.      Harry and Ceci exchange incredulous looks.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TRAILER
dialogues.text: We can hear JOE making PANTING and HOOTING sounds, almost as if he is trying to reason with Jill. Jill coos and makes her own soothing sighs and sounds. Their noises bounce off the metal trailer walls.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE TRAILER
dialogues.text: Everyone exchanges curious glances.      Miss Young is on strange girl. Gregg just smiles. A moment passes -- and then the trailer begins to rock as Jill backs out of it, followed by Joe. She leads him, walking backwards, down the platform, then steps off so he can pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) That's it. That-a-boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe hesitantly takes a few steps forward on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Go on, Joe. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone holds their breath as Joe completes the crossing Gregg looks over at Jill. Her eyes are glistening. Joe heads up through the back of the habitat, already investigating his new home. Everyone exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   Take the platform away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is instantly alarmed.     She turns to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on -- I'm going in with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry shakes his head and motions for the workers to proceed with removing the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We can't allow that. We don't have insurance to cover anyone in there who's not an employee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said -- I'm in charge of Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And I'm in charge of this facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks over at Gregg, distraught. Gregg shakes his head, disgusted -- he sees exactly where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg are at a door that Gregg is unlocking. Jill paces angrily and storms through the door as Gregg opens it. CAMERA FOLLOWS Gregg in. He's carrying her bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Harry) 'I'm in charge of this facility.' Who is that guy? I bet that man hasn't spent one night outside in his entire life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said I was going to be in charge of Joe. I should be sleeping down there, with him, not in this... this... (taking in the space) cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg is grim and quiet. He thinks what she's saying is true. He sets her bags down, detesting the antiseptic space as much as she does. Feeling claustrophobic, Jill dashes to the window and tries to open it. It's a double-paned window. The top doesn't open at all -- the bottom cranks open three inches, barely letting in air. Jill pushes on the window, horrified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with this window? (pushing on it) That's all it opens? That's all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing breathless) This is wrong. This is all wrong... (pleading) Please, fix it, or do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only takes a second. Gregg grabs a pillow from the couch and lays it against the top portion of the window. He gives it one swift karate chop, breaking out the glass He methodically breaks out the remaining shards, dusts of the pillow, and carefully replaces it on the couch. Jill just stares at him, open-mouthed.    Gregg looks her straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I'll do everything I can for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small voice) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conservancy is quiet at night, except for the occasional ANIMAL sound rising into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill leans on her elbows, staring out her recently-broken window, a lost look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA LEAVES Jill's window and FINDS Joe, sitting in his man-made grassy field, looking equally lost and lonely. He is unsure of what to do with himself, confused by his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA FINDS Gregg, leaning against the bar at the edge of the moat. His face is soft as he watches Joe. Joe lists his mammoth head and looks up towards the right corner of his habitat. Gregg follows Joe's eyeline and sees that Joe is looking at a TRANSFORMER. The ELECTRIC BUZZ reaches Gregg's ear... and he becomes aware of it in a new way. He hears its HUM the way Joe hears it -- strange, menacing. Gregg shakes his head to himself -- why didn't the designers pay attention to this? He looks back at Joe, almost apologetically, and is startled to find that: Joe is looking back at him. It is the first time these two have had real eye contact, and for Gregg it is almost overwhelming. Man and beast read each other's faces, and it is in this moment that the giant ape becomes more than a phenomenon to Gregg. Gregg finally feels some of what Jill has been feeling. He connects to Joe. And Joe connects to Gregg. It's just a blink of the eye, a turn of the head -- but it's there. And they both feel it.

dialogues.speaker: 51C OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily runs up to the front of the main building, where Harry is waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Gregg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me. He collected his pay check. He's probably in some jungle by now, not using deodorant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he should be here. This is his discovery, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Gregg's expertise is pitching tents, not explaining primate behavior to the Chairman of the Conservancy Board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I think, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling I'm gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Gregg? Don't be ridiculous. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crippled with envy. In the distance, we see a Cadillac approaching on the Conservancy roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once I wanted to go into the field and find a new species... mollusk, anything. Instead, he makes the zoological discovery of the century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he still has a full head of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily nods to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac comes to a stop in front of them. A distinguished man in a business suit steps out. This is ELLIOT BAKER, the Chairman of the Board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot.   Good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry.    Dr. Banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He claps his hands together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?   Let's go see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Cecily walk with     a conservative-looking man his fifties, Elliot Baker,     the Chairman of the Board the conservancy. Harry is      working for brownie points excitedly pointing out his     "important role" in discov Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always had a suspicion that the legend coming out of the Pangani forest might have some truth to it. It was just a hunch -- sort of a gut feeling -- but I sent my field zoologist to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily shoots a look at Harry. She's not going to let him grab the glory away from Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That field zoologist, Dr. O'Hara, had a theory -- and Joe's blood work confirms it. The gorillas in the Pangani carry a recessive gene that pops up every four or five generations with this rare form of gigantism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) And that's where the legend comes from! That zoologist of yours -- what's his name, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begrudging) Gregg O'Hara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty damn sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kills Harry. Cecily snickers.      They arrive at th fence surrounding Joe's habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up to the observation railing.        Baker cra neck. Joe's nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Joe! Here, Joe! (apologetic joke to Baker) I told him the Chairman of the Board was coming and he promised to come say 'hi.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily gaps and mouths "kiss ass" behind Baker's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. We'll feed him.    That'll get him to come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing.   Let's open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily hesitantly pulls out her keys to the security gate

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mementos, photos, and fabrics from home are strewn around, already adding Jill's warmth and personality to the place. Jill is standing at the window hanging an African piece of fabric as a makeshift curtain when a piercing ALARM RINGS OUT over the compound. Worried by the urgent sound of the alarm, Jill steps down and hurries out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill runs out of the building and almost collides with Gregg, who is rushing in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was coming to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! The two of them rush off across the compound.   As they do, they pass...

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: A concrete building that's used to lock down wild animals. Jill watches, nervously, as conservancy workers with tranquilizer rifles stream out of the building and jump into vehicles, heading toward Joe's habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg drive up to the habitat.   As they come close, Gregg finds Cecily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Joe, he's gone crazy! Jill and Gregg follow Cecily towards...

dialogues.speaker: JOE'S HABITAT
dialogues.text: Conservancy workers have entered Joe's habitat and have their guns trained on --

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: who is standing in a clearing, SNARLING and beating his chest. Which is scaring the crap out of...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: who, white as a sheet, hides behind a tree, his hands shaking. He doesn't dare move an inch, for fear Joe will spot him.

dialogues.speaker: BY GATE
dialogues.text: The conservancy workers are raising their tranq rifles, about to fire, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg come running up behind them.   Jill yells to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry!   Jump out from behind the tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.     No way he's gonna jump in front o that gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump out and say 'You found me!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe grabs a bush and tears it from the ground... The guards aim their rifles, fingers on triggers... And Harry, having nothing to lose but his life, jumps out from behind the tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a tense moment, then... Joe stops growling. In the next instant, he starts spinning in a circle, gleefully. Then he dashes off and hides behind a very tiny tree.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY
dialogues.text: completely confused.     Jill walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's playing hide and seek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill starts rooting around in the trees, pretending not to see Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, where are you? Come out, big guy! Where'd he go? (finding him) There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He screams with delight, and spins in a circle again. As it dawns on everyone that she's actually right, and that he's really playing, the guards start to lower their guns. Then they start laughing. An embarrassed Harry slinks by Gregg, who can't help but chuckle as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exhausted Harry catches his breath at the gate around the habitat. Baker has a thoughtful look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that girl in charge of the gorilla, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Elliot, she's got no scientific...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ape is the best fund-raising tool this conservancy has ever seen. He's happy -- I'm happy. Put her on the payroll. Baker turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Cecily watch as Jill plays hide and seek with Joe. Jill dashes away and runs over to Gregg. She is absolutely glowing, bouncing around with happiness.   She grabs both his arms, jumping up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's playing!    Did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes it here! Isn't it great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great. Jill surprises Gregg by giving him a hug. Gregg looks ove her shoulder and sees that Joe is giving him the evil eye He's jealous. Gregg stares back, equally challenging. Jill, unaware of the competition, lets go of Gregg and happily runs back to Joe. Gregg and Joe continue to hold each other's eyes. Cecily sighs and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, babe, but in a pissing match the monkey kicks your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. I was wondering why you hadn't taken off yet. Normally, you're out the door soon as the animal's in his habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got an active imagination, Cecily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. I think Mr. World Traveller has goo-goo eyes for the gorilla girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg scoffs. But from the look on his face, it's clear she's hit a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at Jill's apartment door. She opens it and lights up to see Gregg standing there. Gregg looks past her into the room. She's made some changes; the bed's on the floor and a few large potted ferns crowd the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what you've done with the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad it's always so cold -- somebody broke my window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him and motions for him to come in.     Gre steps just inside the door and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came by to tell you that I think Joe looks real good out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! This is working out -- better than I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and that I'm hitting the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks at Gregg keenly.    He's acting like he's got something to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Africa. (pauses) For a couple of months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stays light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding?   When do you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill just nods. Gregg is struggling -- this is more difficult than it's ever been for him. He tries to be nonchalant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the job, y'know. Always on the road. It's what I like, anyway -- can't stand to be caged up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meet eyes.      They both know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Joe will be okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill shrugs, acting like she doesn't care either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Well...

dialogues.speaker: JILL GREGG
dialogues.text: (overlapping)                    (overlapping) See you when you get back.           I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg turns and heads back down the hall.    Jill sticks head out and calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (biting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Africa for me. She slams the door to her apartment. Gregg freezes for a moment, then continues down the hallway alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CNN reporter delivers a remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... behind me you see the habitat of what experts are calling one of the most important zoological finds of this century. This is the home of what's believed to be the world's largest primate -- a two thousand pound gorilla named Joe. We see a shot of Joe, in his habitat, with a conservancy worker in the f.g., for scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe has been at the California Animal Conservancy for a little more than a month now. He was brought here from Africa by Dr. Gregory O'Hara. According to Dr. O'Hara... PULL BACK FROM the screen to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser, in the main room of his preserve, watches the news report, absolutely riveted. He is polishing a leather object that we can't clearly make out.   Garth stands behind him. Strasser is on the edge of his seat, watching the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) My God. Pindi was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Joe's remarkable size made him a natural target for poachers. Fortunately the California Animal Conservancy's program in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The program continues with more shots of Joe.     Strasse overcome with desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (transfixed) He's beautiful. The most beautiful animal I have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the most valuable, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him.   He belongs here with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking it over) It'll be a bit tricky, won't it? They're not gonna want to part with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!   Be quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser points to the television...

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Intercut with shots of Joe are shots of the conservancy staff. Jill is among them, and her look of displeasure with the photographing of Joe makes her stand out from th staff. This shot is replaced with side by side photograph of Jill and her mother, Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... was raised from infancy by Jill Young, the daughter of famed primatologist Ruth Young. Their closeness stems from a tragic bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Joe and Jill's mothers were killed by poachers, twelve years ago, in the Pangani Forest, orphaning them on the same night.

dialogues.speaker: ON STRASSER
dialogues.text: Emotion surging through him. He realizes now, all at once, exactly who Joe and Jill are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Bloody hell. That's the little monster that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth stops abruptly, glancing at Strasser's hand. He knows better than to mention it directly. Strasser looks down...

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER'S HAND
dialogues.text: tanned, manicured, and missing the thumb and forefinger. The leather he's been polishing this whole time is his prosthetic hand. He straps it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, to himself) I am always amazed how, if you wait long enough, the opportunity for justice finally comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth watches his boss, who seems lost in his private dream of revenge. It's a moment before Strasser looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book us two tickets to America. We're going to pay a visit to this incredible animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at the TV, where Jill is on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know how to convince his current owners to part with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on that foreboding note...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the sleepy face of a shaggy yak. PULL BACK TO a small group of V.I.P.s being led on a tour by Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fellow is one of only three hundred wild yaks remaining on the planet. There are those who would ask, why should we care if this sub-species of yak survives? We SPOT a man blending in with the group. We recognize Garth. He looks quite respectable in a suit. The antsy V.I.P. next to Garth interrupts Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.   Can we see Joe? The other V.I.P.s echo this wish.   Harry refocuses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly can -- for the mere price of a 'Diamond Circle Benefactor Ticket' to tomorrow night's benefit. The V.I.P.s laugh and groan. Garth takes this moment to slip away, unnoticed. Harry twinkles at the V.I.P.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all for a good cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is waving good-bye to the V.I.P.s, who have completed their tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye. Good-bye. (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw money... throw money... Jill and Cecily drive up in an electric cart. Jill jumps out, wearing a conservancy T-shirt, and from the looks of things she's been working hard in the habitat all day. She's a lovely mess, head to toe.

dialogues.speaker: 68A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She runs up to Harry, all energy and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -- see what's in that cart? That's all we have left of the lobelia leaves for Joe. Did you by any chance place that new order I asked for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty) Of course I... actually, perhaps I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) I wouldn't be surprised if you forgot, considering you have so much on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go rush order it for you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily rolls her eyes.     Jill winks at her conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry) She's nice. I'm not. If you forget to order something I need, I'll knock you upside the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily and Harry walk off grumbling at each other like an old married couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep telling you -- stop talking to me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   You love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill smiles to herself. She turns to get back to her other business, and almost walks right into: Gregg. He's been leaning against a wall, and he's caught the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobelia leaves. Should have called me in Africa. I would have brought 'em back for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill just stares for a moment, trying to decide how to handle Gregg's sudden reappearnce. His clothes look travelled in, and another month in Africa has put a deeper shade of brown on his face. He's got the ragged look of someone who's just gotten off a 16-hour flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you running the place, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods and starts walking like someone with urgent business to attend to. Gregg falls in beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back early. What happened? Run out of humvees to crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- just wanted to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frosty) Really? And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I missed Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg smiles teasingly at Jill but she's in no mood to melt that easily. He continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to show my face at the fundraiser tomorrow night... and I guess I got my mind fixed on a good meal in a fine restaurant. Thought you might like to join me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) No thanks. I still don't want to leave Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Still'? Haven't you been out of here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flip) What's to see? Beach is that way, mountains are that way, Mexico's that way, Canada's that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg reaches out and slows her down.    He wants to see her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Have dinner with me, Jill. (tenderly) You won't find a better excuse to brush your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg reaches out and pulls a piece of straw from Jill's tossled locks. She can't help herself anymore -- and breaks into a slow smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll brush my hair if you take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth walks quickly -- but not fast enough to draw attention. He moves along the handrail at the edge of the moat. Takes off his sunglasses and looks for Joe.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: is moving slowly among saplings.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH'S HAND
dialogues.text: as he reaches in his pocket and pulls out one of the poaching dog collars. Garth looks around -- then gives the metal clappers one loud shake -- quickly drops them back into his pocket. Joe reacts immediately to the JANGLING sound. Imprinted deep in his memory. He rises up quickly and GROWLS furiously -- pounding his chest -- looking around for the danger. It's instinctive and frightening. Joe sees Garth and charges him. Joe's anger takes him into the electrified wire around the habitat. JOE ROARS at the shock and recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful and lively night on Venice Beach. A few people have made bonfires along the water's edge, and the MUSIC of a DISTANT bar band wafts through the air. It's a magic night. Gregg and Jill walk away from a funky food shack, festooned with tiny lights. They share a carton of fish and chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is what you call a good meal in a fine restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gregg grins at Jill, all boyish charm. She stiffles a smile, struggling to hold on to her pervious indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't point that smile at me. I'm still mad at you for taking off and leaving me here all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty) I'm sorry -- I had things I had to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't buy it) Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, you weren't all alone. You had Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods at the truth of this.    She continues, almost to herself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) That's right. Me and Joe.   Just like always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a lonliness about Jill as she says this.     Gre senses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing up with him around -- what's it been like for you? I mean -- most guys are afraid of girls' fathers. I can just see a guy telling Joe he'll get you home by midnight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Never had anyone to bring home anyway. All that stuff -- I don't even know what it's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All what 'stuff'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive/dismissive) Whatever you want to call it. Being in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Well -- it's kinda like getting bit by a makiki spider.

dialogues.speaker: 69A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill looks sharply at Gregg.        Not so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?   How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping closer to Jill) You'll get a kind of a fever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fever?   Really. How high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting.   Hallucinations with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... and you'll, uh -- find yourself saying things. Lots of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg is very close to Jill. He wants to kiss her right now. Jill smiles. She knows what he's doing. Maybe she'll let Gregg kiss her. Just then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a beeper off her belt and checks the message.

dialogues.speaker: BEEPER READOUT
dialogues.text: A message scrolls across that says, "GET BACK HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg bolt for the car.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE is on a major destructive rampage, pulling up trees, ROARING, beating his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg, Jill, Cecily and Harry watching Joe's rampage from outside the gate. Jack and Vern run over, covered in mud and overly exited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ripping out saplings like bam-bam-bam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And taking out irrigation pipes. One good yank -- on comes the flood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just pulled out another acacia tree. You know what I paid for those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cecily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what's wrong with him? Cecily shakes her head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Jill's brow is furrowed with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well could you get in there and calm him down before he pulls out the rest of my landscaping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill has done her job.    Joe is calm but spent, leaning against a tree. Jill sits in his lap, softly singing the same lullaby we heard her mother sing to her 12 years ago. She caresses the palm of Joe's giant leathery paw, her tiny white hand almost disappearing in its black folds. Gregg watches, leaning against a tree not ten feet away. It is the most intimate moment between Jill and Joe that he has seen yet. The tableau invokes myth: the beauty in the service of the beast; the man who has come to free her.

dialogues.speaker: 72A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gregg comes forward... slowly... but Joe suddenly lifts his head and GRUNTS at him, a kind of warning bark for Gregg to stay where he is. Jill doesn't even notice.     She lays her soft cheek against Joe's giant palm.     He cradles her face. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Looking fairly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT to find: Baker, facing off with Jill. She looks flushed with emotion as she follows Baker around the room dogging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) Please, Mr. Baker -- I   wouldn't be asking you to postpone   the benefit unless I thought there   was something really wrong   with Joe. And I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I heard, you sang him to sleep last night like a baby. What's really wrong about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to you, Joe's still not himself -- he's nervous and agitated. He shouldn't be exposed to a crowd of strangers right now. If you would only delay the party a few more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) No.   It's too soon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Baker gives Jill a hard look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Young, let me give you some advice. Stop worrying about Joe, and start worrying about what you'll wear tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Baker gives Jill his back and starts a phone call. Frustrated, Jill turns and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill storms out of Baker's office stewing, head down. She's walking so fast that she collides into a man coming the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!   Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man rights himself and smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, excuse me.     My fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Strasser. He's tamed his looks and dressed himself in modest attire. With his damaged hand concealed in his pocket and a pleasant smile arranged on his face, he has re-invented himself. He comes across like a friendly conservationist. He stares openly at Jill.       It flusters her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning surprise) I'm so sorry -- it's just -- you must be Jill Young...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("moved") And -- you look just like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words electrify Jill.       She almost gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Andre Strasser. An old friend of your mother's. (warmly) I knew her when she was only a little older than you, and you were just a tiny thing. What an incredible woman she was.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill is overwhelmed.     She immediately melts.   She rea her hand out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How wonderful to meet you.   What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser pretends to look uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to talk with your Mr. Baker. (pained) You see, I am here for Joe. And, in a way, for your mother, too. (passionate) I believe she would agree with me -- a magnificent wild animal like Joe needs more space -- like the Raha Preserve I run in Botswana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.   Jill's face falls.    The guilt is working alrea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raha?   A preserve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have twenty thousand acres there where the animals are free to run. I would like to offer them to Joe. (sighs) Here, it's such a shame... to see Joe living in a man-made habitat and being used as an attraction to raise money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser shakes his head at the inhumanity of it all. His clever words work on Jill like a charm -- she looks absolutely crestfallen. He pretends to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- I've upset you! Please... I only mean to offer an alternative. I will be attending the event tomorrow night. Maybe we can talk more about this matter then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser walks off, leaving Jill deep in thought. He smiles to himself, certain he's landed a direct hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tent has been set up outside Joe's habitat, the long end flush up against the railing that surrounds the moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, elegant and tasteful party. A collection of fifty VIPs, all dressed to the nines, mingle with the conservancy staff. Tables have been arranged in a wide semi-circle around a podium, which is on the moat edge of the tent.

dialogues.speaker: BY BAR
dialogues.text: Gregg, wearing a tuxedo, walks up to Cecily and Harry, also in black tie. Harry is stuffing his face. Cecily looks admiringly at Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you clean up nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily -- you're ravishing. Harry -- you got shrimp on your shirt. Harry looks down at his shirt smeared with cocktail sauce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismayed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I look ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You look fine. (pointing at Jack and Vern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look ridiculous. Jack and Vern are off the dweeb-scale in their ill-fittin tuxes. They crowd the food table, gobbling down appetizers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel-lo.   Look what we have here. Gregg and Cecily turn to see what Harry's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: BY ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Jill has just stepped into the tent, looking absolutely stunning. All heads turn too look at her. Intimidated, she falters at the door, too afraid to enter.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON STAFF
dialogues.text: Like everyone else in the room, Cecily and Harry admire Jill. Gregg is rendered speechless by her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud) I picked out the dress.   Aren't I smart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg picks up a glass of champagne for Jill and starts crossing the room to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, Harry -- you're catching flies.

dialogues.speaker: ON JILL
dialogues.text: Feeling terribly insecure, Jill gratefully watches Gregg cross the room towards her. They can't take their eyes off each other. When he reaches her side, she grabs on to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-conscious) Tell me the truth -- do I look stupid in this? Everyone is staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) They're not staring at you. (looks around) They're staring at that... uh... banana tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill turns and sees a ridiculous-looking decorative mountain of bananas sitting on a table top just behind her. It's the creation of an over-zealous caterer. Jill blushes, realizing Gregg's joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS ROOM
dialogues.text: Strasser and Garth observe the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a turnout they have here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, can I have your attention, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser puts his drink down, taps Garth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them head for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you laid eyes on something so unique, so spectacular, that it literally took your breath away? Well, prepare yourselves, for tonight you will have such an experience.

dialogues.speaker: WITH STRASSER AND GARTH
dialogues.text: Heading for the exit, they hear Baker's words and exchang a knowing glance -- if they have their way, tonight will be more of an "experience" than Baker is bargaining for. Garth slips his hand into his jacket, checking for the dog collar... Just as Jack and Vern start coming the other way. Jack's already had one glass too many, and he's reckless on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vern) There's nothing in this punch, man. I could drink twelve of these and not feel a thing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smack! Jack collides with Garth, causing Garth to drop the dog collar. Vern stoops to retrieve it, (picking it up by a rusty key that is one of the clanking objects on the collar).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!   Here's your... uh... key chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth grabs it back.      Strasser nods coolly to Vern an Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vern and Jack stumble on, none the wiser. Strasser and Garth slip out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is feeding on bamboo in the center of his habitat when something abruptly catches his ear. A slight JANGLING sound, the TIMPANI of WIND CHIMES, floating through the air. It GROWS LOUDER. Joe stands up. The hair on his neck bristles. He moves towards the source of the sound, at the edge of the moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth stands at the railing surrounding the moat, rattling the dog collars. It's a sound that haunts him, from the darkest depths of his memory. He starts to GROWL and then he sees something that really drives him nuts. Strasser steps into the light, joining Garth by the water's edge. He rattles the dog collar, and now...

dialogues.speaker: ON JOE
dialogues.text: His eyes, locking with Strasser's. His pupils narrow, his nostrils flare, and Joe FREAKS OUT! He starts tearing up the ground, beating his chest, then he ROARS and charges straight for them, stopping at the water's edge.

dialogues.speaker: ON STRASSER
dialogues.text: locking eyes with Joe. This is the first time he has seen Joe since the animal bit his hand off twelve years ago. A smile creeps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) So you haven't forgotten me.   Good. (holding up his dead hand) Have you forgotten this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth is still rattling the dog collar, enjoying Joe's display of rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the big guy is worth? A couple million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will get that for the paws alone. After we sell him off piece by piece, who knows how much we'll make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth shakes the dog collar more furiously, making Joe rush at them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you going now! That should rattle the jewelry off the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating dog collar) Hang it there -- where he can see it. (warning) And come back for it -- after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth hangs the dog collar on the fence. Joe can hear it clank in the breeze -- he is in a truly frightening state

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, we've done our job here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Strasser and Garth leave, Joe looks after them, beside himself with fury. Outraged, he turns this way and that way, finally focusing on a tall tree in his habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the podium, Baker is making his presentation to the tony crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now to introduce our remarkable new acquisition, I would like to bring up to the podium the director of the conservancy... A sudden ROAR coming from behind the curtain drowns out Baker's voice. The audience members jump in their seats, frightened. Baker is rattled, too, then regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! I suppose there's no need to add to that introduction. The audience laughs and relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Dr. Harry Ruben. Baker motions to Harry, who freezes with a sudden bout of stage fright. Cecily gives him a discreet push on the back and he stumbles forward. JOE can still be heard GROWLING and beating his chest in the background. Jill and Gregg look at each other with mounting anxiety. Harry reaches the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the time it took you to drive here tonight, three species have disappeared from the Earth. Extinct. Never to return. We here at the conservancy say this is a tragedy... Another O.S. ROAR from JOE. It is spine-tingling.    Harr almost jumps out of his loafers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous joke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously Joe agrees. Everybody laughs. The audience doesn't know enough to be really afraid -- they're just excited and twittering.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill is feeling increasingly nervous. She glances around the room and meets eyes with Strasser. He nods at her, his eyes indicating that he is "worried" for Joe as well. Jill nods back. We continue to hear uncanny SOUNDS from behind the curtai It's all Harry can do to stick to his speech. He keeps glancing nervously over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But tonight, rather than focusing on what we've lost, I'm going to introduce you to something we've found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a tremendous CRACKING sound from behind the curtain. The audience murmurs. Harry sweats. Jill grabs Gregg's hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the California Animal Conservancy proudly introduces our newest member, Mighty Joe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Before Harry can say "Young," a TREE comes CRASHING through the curtain. Gregg leaps forward, knocking Harry out of the way just as the tree crushes the podium into kindling. Joe comes blasting through the hole in the curtain.    He has joined the party. Joe stands on the stage, his chest heaving. There is total silence. The party guests are frozen with fear, literally speechless. A few of them laugh nervously, wondering if this is really just part of the show. But Jill knows better. She and Gregg exchange glances -- what the hell is going on? Jill rises, trying to stay calm herself, and slowly approaches Joe, speaking in a soothing voice. She wants to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) Hey, Joe. I'm right here. You hear me? Good boy. Take it easy, Joe. We don't want to scare anybody, do we?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jill is within arm's reach of Joe -- it looks like he might turn his head to her, calm down, become docile... But that's when he spots Strasser. Joe's face registers towering rage as Strasser stares back, provoking Joe further. Joe takes off, knocking over a table that bangs into Jill and sends her flying backwards into a wall. She hits the wall and sinks down, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: heads through the people towards Strasser.        The par erupts with screams. Joe makes his way towards Strasser, swatting people out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: ON STRASSER
dialogues.text: Frozen, in horror, as Joe plows through the party, headin straight for him. Tables are broken like match sticks, GLASS SHATTERS. Joe catches up to Strasser, grabs his tuxedo jacket and hoists him into the air.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It's not Strasser. Frustrated, Joe flings him aside. The man flies through the air, slamming into the tent wall, and then falling on the catering table.

dialogues.speaker: ON GREGG AND JILL
dialogues.text: As they watch Joe's rampage in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.   What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to bring him down.   I'm going for the tranq guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- let me stop him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Gregg's already taken off.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Mighty Joe is still looking for Strasser, as he heads back across the room. A glamorous couple, (TERRY and RAY), crawls frantically on all fours, trying to stay ahead of Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Faster! Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: is pushing against the tide of people to get to Joe. Somebody shoves against her hard: it's Baker, in a panic to get away.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: continues to make his way towards Strasser.   As he rushe towards him... A security guard runs into the tent, raising his TRANQ gu and FIRES... The dart misses, hitting a fleeing guest, who, we see as he crumples to the ground, is actually Baker.

dialogues.speaker: STRASSER
dialogues.text: is fleeing for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: chases him through the tent. A guest falls in Joe's path and Joe heedlessly steps on his leg, crushing it. The man screams in agony.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: is scrambling over broken tables and chairs to get to Joe when he turns sharply away from her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Strasser is trapped behind a table. JOE throws the table out of his way, ROARS and is about to crush a cowering Strasser into poacher mulch, when... SFX: the EXPLOSION of a RIFLE.   Joe looks surprised at first. Joe drops to all fours, revealing Gregg holding a tranq gun. Other Animal Control Officers are with him, also holding tranq rifles. Gregg lowers his gun, a pained expression on his face. But one tranq dart is not enough to stop Mighty Joe.    H rises again, ready to smash Strasser... And a HAIL of TRANQ DARTS sail through the air as the conservancy workers pepper Joe with SHOTS. Joe swipes several darts from his flank -- but the accumulation is too much even for him. He stumbles backward and falls. Jill screams.   Gregg looks sick at the sight of Joe falling. Joe hits the ground hard.   His eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grim-faced FEMALE REPORTER faces the camera. The tent is sprawled on the ground in the b.g. As she starts to speak we PAN PAST a line of other TV news reporters delivering essentially the same report TO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officials here are saying they don't know what caused the animal's rampage, which injured over a dozen people, eight of which are currently hospitalized. Three of those have already filed law suits, and word has it that the City Attorney is calling for the animal to be put to sleep. Standing with me is the chairman of the Conservancy board, Elliot Baker.

dialogues.speaker: A81 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns to her left and INTO FRAME we see Mr. Baker, steeling himself for the consequences of last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Baker, what is the Conservancy doing to assure the public Joe won't attack again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe has been transferred to a special steel reinforced concrete bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about after you let him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be happening anytime soon. In the meantime, we will do anything necessary to ensure the safety of the public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A animal control officer has been posted outside the bunker, the conservancy's lockdown building for animals that get out of control. He stands next to his squad car, a rifle at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holding room.    A cage criss-crossed by six-inch steel bars. Joe stares out through one narrow window. He sees a bar-striped slice of blue sky. He reaches up one hand towards the window -- he can't even fit it through the bars. He still looks drugged and despondent. Hunched over. His head almost scrapes the ceiling. His breathing raspy. On the other side of the bars, Jill and Gregg hover like distraught parents. Jill pets Joe's fur through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe... look at me. Over here, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe barely reacts.    Jill is near tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gregg) I knew something was wrong with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think happened out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Joe never would have hurt all those people unprovoked... something must have got to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something.   Or someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks at Gregg, considering this for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see Harry, poking his head in the room. He still looks freaked out from the events of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods. She takes one last look at Joe, then walks out of the room, leaving... Gregg, alone with Joe for the first time since Joe held him upside down in the jungle. Gregg leans against the cage next to Joe. They have never been in such close proximity before. The expressive-ness in Joe's eyes is uncanny -- Gregg feels almost as if he could understand what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply sorry) Well this wasn't in the brochure, was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg looks around at the claustrophobic space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised you wouldn't be put in a cage. I'm sorry, Joe. I helped put you here. And now I'm going to do everything I can to get you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg reaches out for Joe's paw and lays his hand in it. Joe gently curls his fingers around Gregg's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Harry are in the observation area, a glassed-off room that looks into the holding cell. Harry is still extremely rattled from the fiasco of the night before. He's trying to act tough but he's torn up inside, not sur who he's worried about more -- Joe or himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The City Attorney talked to Baker. It wasn't my decision, and there's nothing I can do about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stays in there until they decide what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there? Harry, look at him. He's depressed, he won't eat. If he stays in there, he'll die within days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sue me.    Everybody else is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Harry, either you tell them you're getting Joe out of there or I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? This is way beyond you, and me. Joe freaked out on some very influential people. He's a public relations nightmare. No zoo will take a two-thousand-pound killer gorilla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a killer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and unless you can write a check for millions of dollars to buy him a big back yard somewhere, Joe's got nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?    You're not going to do anything?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry looks at Jill's angry face -- he knows he's just lost her respect and it bugs him more than he'd like to admit. But there's nothing more he can say. He leaves the room, brushing shoulders with Gregg, entering. Judging from the expression on Gregg's face, he's overheard the whole thing. Jill and Gregg look at each other with determination in their eyes. There's no question in either of their minds about what needs to be done next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANIMAL CONTROL OFFICER stands guard outside the bunker Gregg, Cecily, and Jill walk casually towards the Officer The Officer straightens up and looks tough. He comes forward halfway to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our three just breeze on by the Officer into the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg hangs back with the A.C. Officer as Cecily and Jill disappear inside. To buy time for Cecily and Jill, Gregg pretends to take the big lug into his confidences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidential) We're conservancy doctors. Do me a favor -- stay here and guard the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard nods and looks confused.    Gregg disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily takes a key from her pocket and opens the door to Joe's cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Joe. We're leaving. Let's get you out of here. The open door has a stronger effect on Joe than the sedatives in his system. He clambers to his feet and follows Jill out of the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see the Officer has a rifle aimed at Joe. He's terrified. JOE GROWLS ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Banks, the head vet. And I'm taking Joe for a CAT Scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take my orders from Mr. Baker. Put him back in the cage. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer trains his gun on Joe. Joe looks at the Officer menacingly and bares his huge fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly voice) Officer, you don't want to point that gun at him, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer suddenly grabs his neck, which now has a tranquilizer dart sticking out of it. Jill lowers a tranq gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) He didn't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer slumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily steps out of the bunker and blinks a flashlight into the dark. The red taillights of a trailer suddenly appear as a huge tractor trailer backs up towards the bunker. Cecily calls out towards the bunker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Jill and Gregg lead Joe outside as Cecily opens the doors to the trailer. Joe climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now someone steps out of the passenger side of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's Strasser. Avoiding the back of the trailer (where he would encounter Joe), Strasser stays where he is and calls out to Jill in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, I got the plane. It's waiting at the airport. We must hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser holds his hand up in salute to Gregg and Cecily that's about as close as he wants to get to them. Using urgency as an excuse, he jumps back into the trailer before anyone can engage him in further conversation. It's time to say good-bye.    Cecily looks into the back the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss your ugly face. Be good, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don't start a fight with anyone bigger than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps out of the shadows. Everyone turns and looks at him. He feels their eyes on him and shuffles a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better leave out of the west gate. The guard there got called away. Urgent business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill puts her arms around Harry.    He's antsy and embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not such a big coward after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she keeps hugging) Okay, okay, let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry disengages from Jill and disappears back where he came from. Now Cecily turns to Jill.    She hugs her with great emot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write me when Joe gets settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecily moves off, leaving Gregg and Jill alone to say good-bye. They look into each other's eyes, hating to part, everything they have to say to each other still unsaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yearning) You coming to the airport, or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained) I think I better stay here and keep people away from that bunker. Give you a head start before they realize he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is crumbling. For her, it's awful to leave him, but he's not acting heart-broken at all. Confused, she tries desperately to stay light. She chatters like a nervous schoolgirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) Well -- if you're ever in Botswana, come by and take me out to a good meal in a fine restaurant. That is, if you're not afraid to tell Joe that you'll get me home by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't get the rest of her sentence out because Greg is kissing her mouth. It's the kiss he's been wanting to give her since the day he first laid eyes on her. He lets go of her again, leaving her breathlessly looking after him. He walks to the back of the trailer. Gregg and Joe make serious eyes contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly, to Joe) Take care of her for me, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg shuts the trailer door and walks off, not daring to look back. Jill is about to call after him when Strasser steps back out of the passenger's side of the trailer. He whispers urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill!   We must go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill runs to the passenger side of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopping into the trailer, Jill comes face to face with Garth, who is sitting behind the steering wheel. He nods to her, all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Strasser gets in on the other side of Jill, closing the door behind him. She's sandwiched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg stops and turns around for one last look at the trailer as it drives off. Cecily exhales -- this love stuff is too hot to handle -- and follows Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill sits nervously between Strasser and Garth as the trailer leaves the gate of the conservancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Jill. Soon Joe will be back home again. Jill looks straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Cecily walk back through the conservancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many minutes do you give it before the whole world knows he's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five. How many minutes do you give it before we're both lookin' through the want ads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six. They smile warmly at each other, respecting the sacrifice they've both just made.

dialogues.speaker: 88B CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then, Vern and Jack drive up in a Blazer.      They next to Gregg and Cecily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you guys doing here so late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Vern hop out of the car.       Vern is carrying cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker wants the tent cleaned up A.S.A.P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vern holds out the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out the loot we plundered in the wake of mass party panic! This is some weird lost and found, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vern pulls a single high-heeled shoe out of the box and hands it to Cecily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we've got the fun job of getting this stuff back to everybody. (pulls out a toupee) Somebody's head is cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digging in the box again, Vern innocently pulls out the poacher's dog collar. It means nothing to him, but Gregg instantly grabs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Where did you find this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- that was by the habitat. (to Jack) Guess we've got to find those two guys again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) What two guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, uh... (to Vern) What do you think that one guy is? Russian? Lithuanian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes less than a second. Gregg springs into action, grabbing the keys to the Blazer out of Jack's hand. He sprints to the car. Jack and Vern watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill glances nervously back as they drive down surface streets. She looks over at Strasser. In the passing light of the street lamps, he is regaining his sinister sheen. Garth is driving the trailer very fast. They hit a bump, making them lurch in their seat. Jill hears JOE go THUD in the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!   Be careful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always worrying, eh? Your mother was a worrier, too. Always worrying about the gorillas. It made her a lot of enemies. It led to tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tone has something vaguely malevolent in it.    It rankles Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks at Strasser sharply. For the first time, she really notices his strange, leather hand. For reasons she's not yet conscious of, it scares her. Strasser notices that Jill is staring at his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so pretty, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) I'm sorry. (beat) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser and Garth exchange amused glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you could say I had an encounter with a monster. (in Roumanian) Monstrule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser and Garth chuckle -- they think they're just sharing a private joke. But Jill has a troubled look in her eyes -- the foreign epithet has struck a chord from long ago... she struggles to remember... Then she gets it. She sees herself crouching in the forest with Joe over 12 years ago, overhearing Strasser's curses, and her blood runs cold. She glances at Strasser, everything dawning on her at once. The hand... the face... it all comes together for Jill. Strasser catches the look on Jill's face and knows some- thing is wrong. Adrenaline is pumping through her. Unsure of how to make her next move, Jill tries to hide the realization that is crashing down on her... She glances in the side view mirror of the truck and sees: Gregg, driving up behind them in the Conservancy vehicle. Jill's face reacts ever so slightly, but Strasser catches it. He follows her eye line, looking where she looked, and as he also spots Gregg, Jill knows the game is up. She loses it and screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murdering bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill slams her elbow into Strasser's nose. Strasser's face reflexively goes down in his hands. Stunned, Garth swerves at the wheel. Fast as lightning, Jill grabs his hair and slams his face into the dash. Before the men can recover, Jill kicks and claws her way over Strasser's back, fighting toward the open window...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She reaches through the window and grabs onto the side view mirror. The truck door swings open and Jill sails out the door, dangling from her hold on the side view. The speeding truck swerves wildly, banging Jill again and again against the door. Gregg sees her and is horrified at the danger.   He speed up, trying to reach her... Strasser grabs for Jill, trying to pull her back into the truck... she kicks at him and loses her grasp on the side view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill falls, hitting the running board and bouncing hard onto the concrete roadway. Two CARS swerve and CRASH around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the slats in the trailer, Joe sees Jill almost being hit by the cars. He goes crazy, trying to get out, rocking the trailer back and forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill lifts her head off the concrete and screams futilely after Joe:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!   Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser looks back at Jill lying on the road and slams the truck door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garth) Drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth FLOORS it.      The truck speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg sees Jill up ahead and SLAMS on the BRAKES. He jumps out of his car and races to her side. He reaches her and scoops her away, narrowly saving her from being hit by another passing car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheel flies through Garth's hand as he tries to control it. Strasser's face is covered in blood. The trailer rights itself.    Continues on.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg checks Jill over. She is bruised and bloody, but she doesn't seem to notice. She just stares after the trailer and moans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done? Mother, oh, God, what have I done... (to Gregg)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Gregg half-carries her to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Let's go get him back. They see the trailer disappear around the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth tries desperately to steer the truck as the steering wheel burns through his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The picture postcard version.      Lots of neon.   Touris Movie theaters flashing elaborate marquees.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gleaming Harleys parked in a row. INTO FRAME -- trailer -- -- weaves wildly. It clips a car coming the other way and begins to skid sideways through traffic. It enters the intersection kicking off sparks, sending cars swerving away. WIDEN as the truck jackknifes -- and -- skids to a stop -- the back at an acute angle to the cab. A second of eerie silence as -- Out of the stores and theaters, people run towards the accident. They encircle the truck. People press closer trying to get a look. A loud GROWL stops them cold. TILT UP -- top of trailer. -- Joe's fist punches through. WIDEN as Joe tears away the top and pulls himself free -- climbing up atop the truck. Its effect on the crowd is like Pandora opening her box. They all surge backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at the horrified faces simply shouting at him. Confused by the blinding headlights and BLARING HORNS. People stampeded trying to get away -- some stumble on top of each other.

dialogues.speaker: CAB
dialogues.text: Garth helps Strasser from the wreckage.       Neither of are that badly hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser reaches back into the truck cab.       Garth loo around, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police'll be here any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser pulls a leather case from the truck. Then he reaches back in for his hunter's hat -- and sets it firml on his head. We haven't seen Strasser like this since twelve years earlier: the hunter is back. The sound of SIRENS reaches their ears.       Garth is ne as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser has the thousand yard stare.        Garth has to him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!   We need to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them leave the site of the accident, just as..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe drops down from the truck. People on the street run up, take his picture, and run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! It's that gorilla that was on TV!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JOE
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Joe DOWN the boulevard, as he moves in a four- point walk through the intersection and along the boulevard. Two women coming out of a shop see Joe and scream -- that frightens Joe and makes him bare his fangs. Which only makes matters worse. He feints a charge -- and one woman collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is indeed an urban jungle -- made up of neon and steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe walks down the street and bumps into:

dialogues.speaker: PARKED MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Whose ALARM GOES OFF immediately.   Joe wheels and smashe the car until the sound STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: The lights and loud VOICES blend into one single tumult - dangerous and threatening. The sounds of SIRENS tell us the police are coming fast - a block away we see two BLACK & WHITES SCREECH INTO V THROUGH the crowd we see a street kid, RAY, 13, come face to-face with Joe.
