His eyes go wide with the wonder of Joe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... Hey, Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if he's seeing a completely different animal than everyone else around him. It's a look we've seen in young Jill's eyes. Ray looks down the street at the approaching cop cars and back at Joe. He understands the danger. Ray points the right way for Joe to go, away from the police cars. Joe watches Ray closely, as if he were studying the boy's face. Then he moves off in the direction Ray was pointing, towards:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where patrons hang fearfully by the doors.   Theatergoers rush back inside.

dialogues.speaker: IMPRINTS
dialogues.text: for John Travolta and Donald Duck -- As an enormous gorilla foot descends on them. They split down the middle, then crumble into dust.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TICKET KIOSK
dialogues.text: A Mexican-American female ticket-taker hyperventilates, boxed in her tiny glass booth. From HER POV, Joe ducks down and stares at her, bringing his giant face close to the glass. She is speechless with fright. Joe moves on. Now the sounds of POLICE SIRENS can be heard APPROACHING. FIND Joe -- boxed in by the movie theater. Angry. He starts searching for a way out...

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Just then -- two LAPD cars pull up.   COPS jump out.    T spot Joe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there! The Cop points up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe uses his powerful muscles to scale the theater.     H makes it to the top -- high over Hollywood. Behind him are hills and trees.   Something familiar.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON COPS
dialogues.text: They've got their guns aimed, but Joe disappears over the top of the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill pull up to the overturned trailer, see the wreckage... but no sign of Joe. Stunned, they whirl around, hoping he'll still be somewhere in sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't have gotten far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is overwhelmed with frustration. In seconds, she climbs on top of the overturned can and screams at the top of her lungs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Joe!   Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg sees a group of EXCITED NEIGHBORS run down the stre towards Mann's Chinese screaming to each other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill hops down and she and Gregg tear off down the street towards the gathered crowd at the Chinese Theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world famous icon -- starkly white against the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN CLOSE ON the "O."     A shadow moves across the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beat -- then Joe steps through.     He's at the apex of t urban mountain range.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: A beam of light is sweeping back and forth across the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: PUSH IN CLOSE ON JOE -- he GROWLS as if he recognizes it. From this distance it looks like a flashlight beam. In Joe's mind it means only one thing -- Jill. He ROARS -- and moves off across the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jill and Gregg run up, Cops are interviewing witnesses to Joe's flight. One CREW-CUT COP speaks into his walkie- talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders are shoot to kill. He's extremely dangerous. Jill hears this and flips out.    She almost attacks the Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming at Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He's not dangerous! You're dangerous! You're dangerous! The Cop gives Jill a look that says she's two seconds awa from handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't mean that. Gregg drags Jill away before she gets arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back at Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better cool it, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to shoot him. Gregg looks up over the facade of the theater to the hill beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we find him first. POLICE HELICOPTERS BUZZ by overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's follow them. They run back towards their car. 107   EXT. ALLEY NEAR HOLLYWOOD BLVD. Garth and Strasser watch as Jill and Gregg head off after Joe.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Strasser opens the case he retrieved from the truck, starts assembling a hunting rifle. Garth looks at it in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You don't think we can get the gorilla now, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser doesn't even bother to answer the question. finishes loading his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a car.     Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUBBERNECKER sits in his car, a Range Rover, gawking at the police all over Hollywood Blvd. Then a hunting rifle ENTERS FRAME, pressing right against his cheek. The Rubbernecker doesn't even seem scared.     He just shakes his head, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth goddamn time this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his soda from the cupholder, his garage door opener (Guy's been through this before) but before he can reach for his Thomas Guide... Garth hauls him out of the car and throws him on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I was going! No need to be so pushy about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser and Garth jump in the car and drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homes built into the dark green hills. FOLLOW a wooden fence -- a long wooden barrier that's been blown out of its mooring. A MAN in BOXER SHORTS runs out of his kitchen door. His wife behind him. Their DOG is WHINING at something from underneath their deck.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING THROUGH BACK YARD
dialogues.text: The couple can see all the way down back.     Every fence has been knocked over. We TRACK THROUGH the back yards, PAST overturned lawn furniture and downed clotheslines. People stepping out of the doors -- confused.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MAN
dialogues.text: on cordless phone, surveying the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Is this L.A. County Animal Control...? You're not gonna believe this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Joe -- emerging from the thick growth. He can hear the NOISE like a rushing river O.S. He moves to the top of the crest.

dialogues.speaker: SAN DIEGO FREEWAY
dialogues.text: Where the hills are split by the river of light.    Joe looks out over the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe can see the searchlights in the distance. The rushing river of light is an image Joe can't quite assimilate. But somehow Joe knows he must cross this "thing" to get to the hills on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe steps into the first eight lanes of freeway traffic. We hear some SCREECHING and SKIDDING as the first four drivers of the first four CARS in each northbound lane spot Joe and slam on the BRAKES. Miraculously, nobody crashes. Bumpers remain uncrushed. Almost ceremoniously, the oncoming traffic comes to a respectful halt as Joe hesitantly lumbers past.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's almost like church. The freeway becomes quiet. Nobody honks. Nobody screams. Overcome with awe, a woman steps out of her car and just stands there in the middle of the freeway, watching Joe pass. Others follow suit. Joe climbs the center divider.    The same thing happens the southbound lane. As Joe disappears up the hill on the other side, the stunned drivers simply stare in disbelief. L.A. is in awe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill arrive on the scene. They look down from the overpass and see cops swarming around the area where Joe was, shining their flashlights into the brush and talking to motorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea where he might've headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JILL -- drifting off, as something O.S. catches her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points out THROUGH the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: JILL'S POV
dialogues.text: Shining over the horizon, coming from somewhere near the ocean, is a searchlight, piercing the night sky. The image is as familiar to Jill as it was to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where he'll go. He'll think that's me calling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg steps on the accelerator. As their car pulls away, PAN TO Strasser and Garth following a few car lengths behind.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING ACROSS BAY
dialogues.text: The moon-striped water surges and ebbs as we SKIM the waves, RUSHING TOWARDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festival of lights.   Rides, arcades, lots of people.

dialogues.speaker: SEARCHLIGHT
dialogues.text: A kettle light rotating on its base. CAMERA CRANES UP THROUGH the klieg beams REVEALING the park -- CONTINUE TO CRANE UP 'til we see, towering over everything, the new Ferris wheel -- a neon blur spinning grandly against the moon-bright sky.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Quintessentially American images of beach-side amusement park. A carnival-like atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHWAY ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Some couples stop to take their photos, kissing under the iconic neon arch that welcomes people to the park.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COUPLE
dialogues.text: stops to share the view -- and a kiss.   Until a LOUD GROWL makes them jump back. Joe has appeared under the arch. The young girl screams -- her boyfriend pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a slow-motion panic. The noise and tumult of the crowded park keeps people from hearing the screams right away. One toddler smiles and waves at Joe until his mother snatches him and runs for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: AT FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: A crowd of kids waits in line. One of them, a particularl appealing little boy named JASON, is having a conversatio with his MOTHER. She has the aura of a single mom about h and she clearly adores her sweet-faced kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I don't think I can let you go on the ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the last time after you ate two hot dogs, you threw up, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I promised to throw up over the side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both giggle at her joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I think I should do this ride by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Okay... I'll watch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP TO the wheel turning majestically -- filled with kids. Some wave from the chairs as they crest -- it feels like they're flying over the ocean below. We NOTICE two girls (JENNY, seven, and EMMA, nine) as they come over the top. On the way down, they can see the crowd parting below as Joe ENTERS FRAME. At the base of the great wheel -- parents are finally hearing the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: BY LIGHT
dialogues.text: Joe arrives at his destination -- the bright light that drew him here. He's confused by the fact that Jill's nowhere to be found. Desperately, he scans the park... People scream and panic around Joe. The noise drives him deeper into the park, searching for Jill. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: AT ARCADE
dialogues.text: Three college guys shoot replica AIR GUNS at cardboard lions and elephants, setting off fake explosions in a "Big Safari" booth.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: feels threatened and recoils. Then he continues past them. The rush of people away from him gets more frenzied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg run under the archway. People rush past them. They fight their way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta be here.   Do you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill scan the amusement park, looking for the source of all the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth and Strasser have parked at the edge of the amusement park. Strasser has the rifle out and propped up on one knee. He uses the scope as a viewfinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running towards the carnival games.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Garth puts his hand on the barrel of the gun and pulls it away from Strasser's eye. He's so nervous he's almost chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous) Hold on, now -- just who are you aiming at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser looks at Garth with deadly focus. His eyes tell the story. Garth realizes his boss's intentions with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that girl starts telling people who we really are, our whole cover operation will be blown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser aims his rifle again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not an animal. That's a human being you're about to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser fixes Garth with an icy stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go wait in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the gun again, gets the sight lined up just as Gregg and Jill pass near the klieg light. Garth grabs the gun, just as Strasser is about to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Strasser's SHOT, altered by Garth, hits the klieg light behind Jill and Gregg. The LIGHT EXPLODES -- GLASS SHATTERS. Gregg pulls Jill to the ground, as... Sparks shoot out of the klieg light, a few of them hitting the ubiquitous sawdust and straw that buffers the floors of many rides. It takes only one second before there is a flame that begins to spread in a SIZZLING POOL of OIL right at the base of the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: IN BACK OF FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: The FLAME dances over an oil slick and engulfs several sacks of sawdust. It smolders -- then ERUPTS in a much larger conflagration.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FIND one parent (Jenny and Emma's MOTHER) who is nervousl waiting for her children near the bottom of the Ferris wheel. She hears the HISS of the FIRE and sees the shadows cast by the flames. She moves away from the other parents -- into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as she now sees the fire attacking the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferris wheel operator sprays an industrial extinguisher on the flames. He crawls underneath the machine where the fire is worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser, extremely pissed off, turns to look at Garth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very stupid, Garth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a hunter, you're a murderer, and I won't be a part of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser flips the gun and cracks Garth squarely in the head with the rifle butt. Garth hits the ground like a bag of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser turns to look back at the park. He no longer has a clear shot at Jill. He realizes he's going to have to move in close. From his jacket he takes a .45 caliber semi-automatic Match Master and a barrel extension which he screws on with great concentration using his gloved hand. Strasser begins to work his way into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Gregg pick themselves up off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Then they spot the fire, spreading to the Ferris wheel. Gregg turns to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find Joe, get him out of here. (looking towards the wheel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna see if I can help. Gregg moves off towards the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: heads over to the carnival games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strasser, calm and totally committed to his course of action moves through the pandemonium of the crowd, gun by his side.

dialogues.speaker: AT FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: Parents are shouting, crowding the Ferris wheel. Two operators are unloading children as quickly as they can. They look like they are about to be overwhelmed but then... Gregg ENTERS FRAME. He vaults the guard rail, starts unloading children right from their moving cars. There is utter chaos, children screaming, fire and smoke. CRANE UP PAST the terrified faces of the children who have to wait, 'til we GET TO Jenny and Emma. Jenny turns to see the fire beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: is really starting to burn out of control now. It has spread to the engine of the FERRIS WHEEL, which, heated to the bursting point, suddenly EXPLODES. The ride operator with the fire extinguisher is blown through the air, and the Ferris wheel lurches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY AND EMMA
dialogues.text: grip their safety bar as their bucket swings back and forth. Emma nearly falls out -- until Jenny grabs her and holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo-om!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!   Somebody help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg -- sees the girls, their bucket having come to a stop about fifteen feet off the ground. Thinking quickly, he jumps up on the guard railing, then leaps across to their bucket. He just grabs onto the bottom. The bucket shakes back and forth violently, causing the two girls to scream. Gregg looks up at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared. Climb down my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look at Gregg, too nervous to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tentatively, Jenny and Emma climb out of their bucket and onto Gregg's back, using him like a human ladder. They shimmy down to his feet, then drop off, one by one, into the waiting arms of their mother. Gregg lets go of the bucket, drops a good fifteen feet, landing roughly. The girls' mother looks down at Gregg, thankfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!   Oh God, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg, winded, just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phalanx of cop cars races up to the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill moves through the maze of carnival games. She spots Joe, moving through the small buildings, clearly disoriented. She yells out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!   Joe!! But above the tumult, he can't hear her. Jill pushes her way towards him, when she comes face to face with... Strasser. Just yards away.      He flashes his sickening smile, raises his gun... ON JILL -- a look of terror crossing her face as she realizes she's about to die. Then, as a shadow passes over her, her expression of terror melts away. ON STRASSER -- seeing Jill's expression, his smile fades. Why's she so calm all of a sudden? He doesn't even need to turn around to know that: Joe is behind him. As Strasser turns slowly around, Joe reaches down swiftly and hoists Strasser off the ground. The GUN GOES OFF, barely missing Joe. JOE ROARS and crushes Strasser's left hand in his paw, a bone-crunching slow squeeze that makes Strasser scream in agony. Then Joe swings Strasser around and grabs him around the chest with his right paw. He pulls him close to his face and blasts a DEAFENING ROAR into his face. Joe cocks his arm and heaves Strasser with mighty force into the air. Screaming, Strasser hurtles through space with incredible speed, CRASHING right through the flaming signage of the "Big Safari" booth, sending out a SHOWER OF SPARKS... ... and continues flying through the air until WHACK! hangs up on a power line. Strasser slips down, catching his fall with his fake hand This section of the LINE is safe, but directly below it i a cluster of electrical junction boxes. Cracked and blistered by the heat of the nearby fire, they are sparki dangerously -- to fall on to them would mean certain electrocution.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Strasser's bad hand begins to slip from the wire. Desperate, he reaches up with his left hand to grab on -- only to remember that this hand has just been crushed by Joe, and is useless to him now. Strasser helplessly watches as his prosthetic comes unclasped from his hand and he slips the last, fatal fraction of an inch. Strasser falls onto the junction boxes, which explode in a shower of sparks. Strasser sizzles and dies, while abov him, the prosthesis still swings on the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stands where she is, frozen at the horrible sight of what has just happened. A dozen people scream and recoil. A swarm of policemen, led by Commander Gorman, watch Joe's violent action in stunned silence. Gorman motions to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the marksmen up here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill knows what's coming. Convincing Gorman is hopeless. She runs to Joe. Fearing for his life, she calls for him to follow her deeper into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Joe.    Come on.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: Gregg is catching his breath on the ground near the Ferri wheel. Jill runs up to him, Joe close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly) Joe got Strasser. He was trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I just hope they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to the cops, who have set up at the park's edge.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: He's not looking at the cops. He's focused on the Ferris wheel. The fire is burning near the metal supports that hold it upright. With each passing minute, the wheel's moorings are getting looser. PAN UP TO a bucket at the very top of the wheel. Two small hands hold on for dear life. He starts moving towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next instant, Joe has started running for the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe!

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: are getting into firing squad position.       A SHARPSHOO follows Joe through his scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to fellow cop) Talk about an easy target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Joe right in his crosshairs, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill run into the crosshairs, waving their arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Gorman comes forward, yelling at Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gregg) Get out of the way. Get back. (to cops) Ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! He's not dangerous, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commander is furious at these two civilians keeping him from his job. He barks orders to two cops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to two cops) Get them out of here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are about to move on Gregg and Jill when Jason's Mother, panic-stricken, runs up to Gorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, help! I can't find my son! I think he's still on the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to look at the Ferris wheel...

dialogues.speaker: SHARPSHOOTER
dialogues.text: follows Joe's ascent through his viewfinder.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: A frightened six-year-old boy pops his head up from a bucket. Everyone is stunned as they see this lone child -- trapped at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in agony) Oh my God! Jason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN to reveal -- Joe is heading straight for Jason. Massive muscles pulling him up higher, towards the endangered boy.

dialogues.speaker: ON GORMAN
dialogues.text: ready to shoot Joe. Jill turns to Jason's Mother, quietly pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll save your boy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jason's Mother looks at Jill, panicking.      She swallow hard and turns to Gorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot. (beat) Let him try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorman looks at Jason's Mother, then at Joe. Then at the boy at the top of the Ferris wheel. He motions to his men

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe climbing with all his strength, comes to the top of the Ferris wheel. ON JASON -- staring, wide-eyed, at this miraculous animal. He watches, in awe, as Joe extends a massive hand and lifts him out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: ON GROUND
dialogues.text: All eyes watch, in awe, as Joe presses Jason to his massive chest. ON JILL -- smiling through tears.    Gregg puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: Camera crews from local TV news stations have poured into the park. They film all of this.

dialogues.speaker: AT BASE OF WHEEL
dialogues.text: The wood attached to the metal supports has completely burned through. With a terrible CRACKING sound, the SUPPORTS begin to tear away. Another EXPLOSION rocks the WHEEL.   It SHUDDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN SHOT -- The Ferris wheel begins to tip over. ON JILL -- a look of horror passes over her face as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to tip! Everyone back up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts backing away from the wheel. The wheel seems to fall slowly -- like in a dream -- sending debris and flames spilling across the park.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOE
dialogues.text: As he cradles Jason tight in his arms. The wheel begins to fall towards the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joe jumps away from the burning wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ground comes rushing up at him.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: hits hard, just clearing the falling wheel by inches. doesn't move. PAN the crowd -- an eerie silence falls over everyone. The only sound the CRACKLING of the FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: breaks free from Gregg and runs toward Joe.   Jason's Mother races with her.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOE
dialogues.text: Motionless on his back. Still cupping the boy, nestled and protected against his massive chest. A beat -- then Jason looks up from Joe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's Mother bursts into joyous sobs as her son climbs into her arms. A general sense of relief passes through the crowd, except for...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: She kneels by Joe stroking his great chest. Joe doesn't respond. Jill bows her head and cries deeply. People back away to give her room. How strange to see this huge, powerful animal stilled. Gregg comes and kneels by Joe's side. He checks for a heart beat. For wounds. Joe doesn't stir. Gregg is devastated, too. PAN CROWD... Firemen, paramedics and television reporters run through the park. The paramedics lead off the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Still holding her boy, Jason's Mother comes forward. She recognizes what Jill is going through her own version of mother's grief. She approaches respectfully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is beyond comfort. She's in another world. Humming their lullaby, she rests her soft cheek in Joe's giant pa for the last time. Her blonde hair spills on his fingers... And then, SLOWLY ENTERING FRAME, a giant finger reaches f Jill's cheek and strokes it gently... It takes Jill a moment to realize she hasn't imagined this... she opens her eyes, sees the moving fingers, turn to look into Joe's face, just as his eyes open... Elated, Jill moves up to Joe's head and kisses his face a thousand times. Gregg takes a deep breath, privately thanking God. Jason's Mother is tearful -- Jason is all smiles. Jill tearfully blathers soothing words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing Joe's head) That's right, Joe -- that's right, big guy. That was a big fall but you're okay, aren't you? You're tough. You're so tough. Yes you are. Yes you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking Joe over) We've got to get him checked out. (looking around at crowd) And get him somewhere safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill looks at Gregg with a heavy heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter/rhetorical) Somewhere safe? Where is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's Mother breaks in timidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) Perhaps... I mean, maybe... isn't there anything we can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason pushes in front of his mother. He reaches out his little hand and pets Joe. He looks up at Jill and Gregg with a shining face and smiles hopefully. (ALTERNATE END OF SCENE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill shakes her head at the mother and continues to pet Joe softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) No. I don't think so. Not unless you have a few million dollars on you to buy him a home somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's mother nods hopelessly, comprehending the difficulty of the situation. But Jason has also heard Jill's words. He pushes in front of his mother, reaches into his pocket and pulls out a crumpled dollar bill. He hands it to Jill and Gregg with a shining face and smiles hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   For Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg and Jill are moved by the gesture. Gregg respect- fully takes the dollar from the little boy while everyone looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorman and his men exchange glances, also touched by the little boy's deed. Now Gorman reaches into his pocket and pulls out a ten. He comes forward and hands it to Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the other cops are reaching into their pockets.    Th come forward with dollars in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   For Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregg's hands and pockets are being stuffed with money as dozens of people begin to come forward with whatever they can afford. Gregg looks at Jill, overwhelmed by what's happening, and her face echoes his emotions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason walks up and down the aisle collecting pennies. He holds a collection can that reads, simply, "Joe."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy commuters rush through turnstiles -- but stop long enough to throw money into a big Joe bucket manned by a guy wearing a gorilla suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ray and his street-tough buddies collecting money for Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kweli walks through the outdoor bar, collecting money for Joe from a half dozen villagers. A hand, holding a few crumpled bills, taps him on the back. Kweli turns around and comes face to face with Pindi. Pindi stuffs the money in Kweli's can and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Mighty Joe, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumped on the ground of the post office.   PULL BACK as four more bags are dumped. PUSH IN CLOSE ON one envelope -- with an obviously foreign stamp simply addressed: "Joe Young, America."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue sky above Africa.    CRANE DOWN to see: An entry gate with the words "Joe Young Wildlife Park" printed across the top. Beneath the gate: Kweli, standing with Jill and Gregg, is blowing a ceremonial horn, sending an ancient blessing into the air. As he finishes, we hear applause. PULL BACK to reveal 35 people -- locals, villagers, friends -- applauding the opening of the park. Voiceover begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Cecily: I promised to write you when Joe was settled and now I finally can. We finally dedicated the Joe Young Wildlife Park last week and it was one of the happiest days of my life. At last I have kept my promise to my mother. Under the gate, Jill jumps joyously on Gregg, and he whirls her around in a tight embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe seems so happy here. I know he feels that he's safe. Gregg looks O.S. and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joe -- come on, big guy... Joe comes walking INTO FRAME. Gregg smiles at Jill, very pleased with himself that Joe responds to him now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Gregg have become good friends. They even play together. And that jealous rivalry they had? It's all gone. Joe swats Gregg to the ground and takes his place next to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... almost all gone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Not completely amused, Gregg picks himself up and raises a warning finger at Joe. Joe looks over at him, and purses his lips at Gregg, as if laughing at his own rough play. Joe turns and walks away up the hillside. Jill helps Gregg up. He puts his arm around her and kisses her hair. They watch Joe go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long journey getting to this place, but Joe is finally home. I think we all are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK over the crowd of villagers who have begun singing a powerful African hymn. As the sound of their singing rises into the mountain sky, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH Joe, who begins to run now, limbs out- stretched with energy and joy, claiming his freedom. The CAMERA RISES OFF of Joe to the verdant African landscape beyond. Joe's home -- protected and free.
